verses.ar_en: Moshe said: “This is how you will know that Adonoy has sent me to perform all of these deeds, for, I did not devise them myself [from my own will].

verses.ar_he: אִם כְּמוֹתָא דְכָל אֱנָשָׁא יְמוּתוּן אִלֵין וּסְעָרָא דְכָל אֱנָשָׁא יִסְתְּעַר עֲלֵיהוֹן לָא יְיָ שַׁלְחַנִי
verses.ar_en: If as all men die will these men meet their deaths, and the reckoning (fate) of all men will be reckoned upon them, then Adonoy has not sent me.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם בְּרִיאָה יִבְרֵי יְיָ וּפְתָחַת אַרְעָא יָת פּוּמַהּ וְתִבְלַע יַתְהוֹן וְיַת כָּל דִי לְהוֹן וְיֶחֱתוּן כַּד חַיִין לִשְׁאוֹל וְתִדְעוּן אֲרֵי אַרְגִיזוּ גוּבְרַיָא הָאִלֵין קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: If Adonoy will create a [new] creation and the ground will open its mouth and swallow them along with all of their belongings, and they will go down alive to the grave, then you will know that these men have angered Adonoy.”

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד שֵׁיצֵי לְמַלָלָא יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמַיָא הָאִלֵין וְאִתְבְּזָעַת אַרְעָא דִי תְּחוֹתֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: As he was finishing speaking all these words the ground beneath them split.

verses.ar_he: וּפְתָחַת אַרְעָא יָת פּוּמָהּ וּבְלָעַת יַתְהוֹן וְיַת אֱנַשׁ בָּתֵּיהוֹן וְיַת כָּל אֱנָשָׁא דִי לְקֹרַח וְיַת כָּל קִנְיָנָא
verses.ar_en: The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them and their houses [household members] and all the people belonging to Korach and all of the possessions.

verses.ar_he: וּנְחָתוּ אִינוּן וְכָל דִי לְהוֹן כַּד חַיִין לִשְׁאוֹל וַחֲפַת עֲלֵיהוֹן אַרְעָא וַאֲבָדוּ מִגוֹ קְהָלָא
verses.ar_en: They, and all belonging to them, went down alive to the grave, and the earth covered them and they perished from among the assembly.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל יִשְׂרָאֵל דִי בְסַחֲרָנֵיהוֹן עֲרָקוּ לְקַלְהוֹן אֲרֵי אֲמָרוּ דִלְמָא תִבְלְעִנָנָא אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: All of Yisroel who were around them fled from their uproar, for they said, perhaps the earth will swallow us.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶשָׁתָא נְפָקַת מִן קֳדָם יְיָ וַאֲכָלַת יָת מָאתָן וְחַמְשִׁין גַבְרָא מְקַרְבֵי קְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא
verses.ar_en: A fire came forth from [before] Adonoy and consumed the two hundred and fifty men who were bringing the [fragrant] incense.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: אֱמַר לְאֶלְעָזָר בַּר אַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנָא וְיַפְרֵשׁ יָת מַחְתְּיָתָא מִבֵּין יְקִידַיָא וְיָת אֶשָׁתָא יַרְחִיק לְהָלָא אֲרֵי אִתְקַדָשׁוּ
verses.ar_en: “Say to Elazar the son of Aharon, the kohein and have him lift up the firepans from the inferno, and you, scatter the fire yonder, for, they were sanctified;

verses.ar_he: יָת מַחְתְּיַת חַיָיבַיָא הָאִלֵין דְאִתְחַיְיבוּ בְּנַפְשָׁתֵיהוֹן וְיַעְבְּדוּן יַתְהוֹן טַסִין רְדִידִין חוֹפָאָה לְמַדְבְּחָא אֲרֵי קָרֵבֻנוּן קֳדָם יְיָ וְאִתְקַדָשׁוּ וִיהֶוְיָן לְאָת לִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: [These] firepans of these sinners [who paid] with their souls, and make them into hammered sheets to overlay the altar, for they were brought in offering before Adonoy and they were sanctified; and they shall be for a sign for Bnei Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב אֶלְעָזָר כַּהֲנָא יָת מַחְתְּיָתָא דִנְחָשָׁא דְקָרִיבוּ יוֹקִידַיָא וְרַדִידֻנוּן חוֹפָאָה לְמַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: Elazar the kohein, took the copper firepans, those that the fire victims brought and hammered them into a covering for the altar,

verses.ar_he: דָכְרָנָא לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּדִיל דִי לָא יִקְרַב גְבַר חִלוֹנַי דִי לָא מִזַרְעָא דְאַהֲרֹן הוּא לְאַסָקָא קְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמִין קֳדָם יְיָ וְלָא יְהֵי כְקֹרַח וְכִכְנִשְׁתֵּיהּ כְּמָא דִי מַלֵיל יְיָ בִּידָא דְמשֶׁה לֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: to be a reminder for Bnei Yisroel so that a commoner shall never offer, one who is not a descendant of Aharon, to burn [fragrant] incense before Adonoy; so as not to be like Korach and his congregation; as Adonoy spoke to him, through Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְרַעֲמוּ כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִיוֹמָא דְבַתְרוֹהִי עַל משֶׁה וְעַל אַהֲרֹן לְמֵימָר אַתּוּן גְרַמְתּוּן דְמִית עַמָא דַיְיָ
verses.ar_en: They complained—the entire congregation of Bnei Yisroel—on the next day against Moshe and Aharon, saying: “You have killed [caused the death] the people of Adonoy”

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּאִתְכַּנָשׁוּת כְּנִשְׁתָּא עַל משֶׁה וְעַל אַהֲרֹן וְאִתְפְּנִיאוּ לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְהָא חֲפָהִי עֲנָנָא וְאִתְגְלִי יְקָרָא דַיְיָ
verses.ar_en: When the congregation assembled against Moshe and Aharon, they turned to the Tent of Meeting and behold! The cloud covered it, and the Glory of Adonoy appeared.

verses.ar_he: וְעָאל משֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן לָקֳדָם מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: Moshe and Aharon came to the front of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: אִתְפְרָשׁוּ מִגוֹ כְּנִשְׁתָּא הָדָא וְאֱשֵׁיצֵי יָתְהוֹן כְּשָׁעָה וּנְפָלוּ עַל אַפֵּיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: “Remove [separate] yourselves from this congregation and I shall annihalate them in an instant,” and they fell upon their faces.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְאַהֲרֹן סַב יָת מַחְתִּיתָא וְהַב עֲלַהּ אֶשָׁתָא מֵעִלָוֵי מַדְבְּחָא וְשַׁו קְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא וְאוֹבִיל בִּפְרִיעַ לִכְנִשְׁתָּא וְכַפֵּר עֲלֵיהוֹן אֲרֵי נְפַק רָגְזָא מִן קֳדָם יְיָ שָׁרֵי מוֹתָנָא
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to Aharon: “Take the firepan and put fire from atop the altar on it and place [fragrant] incense on it, and go quickly to the congregation and atone for them, for anger has come forth from before Adonoy; the plague has commenced.”

verses.ar_he: וּנְסֵיב אַהֲרֹן כְּמָא דְמַלֵיל משֶׁה וּרְהַט לְגוֹ קְהָלָא וְהָא שָׁרֵי מוֹתָנָא בְּעַמָא וִיהַב יָת קְטּוֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא וְכַפֵּר עַל עַמָא
verses.ar_en: Aharon took, just as Moshe spoke, and he ran to the middle of the assembly and behold! The plague had commenced among the people. He put on incense and he atoned for the people.

verses.ar_he: וְקָם בֵּין מֵתַיָא וּבֵין חַיַיָא וְאִתְכְּלִי מוֹתָנָא
verses.ar_en: He stood between the dead and between the living and the plague was halted [ceased].

verses.ar_he: וַהֲווֹ דְמִיתוּ בְּמוֹתָנָא אַרְבַּעַת עֲשַׂר אַלְפִין וּשְׁבַע מְאָה בַּר מִדְמִיתוּ עַל פְּלֻגְתָּא דְקֹרַח
verses.ar_en: The dead in the plague totaled fourteen thousand seven hundred, excluding those who died due to Korach’s rebellion [division].

verses.ar_he: וְתָב אַהֲרֹן לְמשֶׁה לִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וּמוֹתָנָא אִתְכְּלִי
verses.ar_en: Aharon returned to Moshe to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and the plague was halted.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: מַלֵיל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְסַב מִנְהוֹן חוּטְרָא חוּטְרָא לְבֵית אַבָּא מִן כָּל רַבְרְבָנֵיהוֹן לְבֵית אֲבָהַתְהוֹן תְּרֵי עֲשַׂר חוּטְרִין גְבַר יָת שְׁמֵיהּ תִּכְתּוֹב עַל חוּטְרֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: “Speak to Bnei Yisroel and take from among them a staff, a staff for each father’s [tribal] house, from all the leaders according to their fathers’ houses, twelve staffs; and you shall write each man’s name on his staff.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת שְׁמָא דְאַהֲרֹן תִּכְתּוֹב עַל חוּטְרָא דְלֵוִי אֲרֵי חוּטְרָא חָד לְרֵישׁ בֵּית אֲבָהַתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall write the name of Aharon on the staff of Levi, for, [there is] one staff for the head of their fathers’ house.

verses.ar_he: וְתַצְנְעִינוּן בְּמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא קֳדָם סַהֲדוּתָא דִי אֲזַמִין מֵימְרִי לְכוֹן תַּמָן
verses.ar_en: You shall leave them inside the Tent of Meeting before the testimony where there I [My word] meet you.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי גַבְרָא דִי אִתְרְעֵי בֵּהּ חוּטְרֵיהּ יִנְעֵי וַאֲנִיחַ מִן קֳדָמַי יָת תּוּרְעֲמַת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל דִי אִנוּן מִתְרַעֲמִין עֲלֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: It shall be that the man whom I choose, his staff shall blossom; and I will abate from Myself [before Me] the complaints of Bnei Yisroel that they complain against you.”

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵיל משֶׁה עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וִיהָבוּ לֵיהּ כָּל רַבְרְבָנֵיהוֹן חוּטְרָא לְרַבָּא חָד חוּטְרָא לְרַבָּא חָד לְבֵית אֲבָהַתְהוֹן תְּרֵי עֲשַׂר חוּטְרִין וְחוּטְרָא דְאַהֲרֹן בְּגוֹ חוּטְרֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Moshe spoke to Bnei Yisroel and all the leaders gave to him a staff for each leader; a staff for each leader, according to their fathers’ house, twelve staffs, and the staff of Aharon [was] among their staffs.

verses.ar_he: וְאַצְנַע משֶׁה יָת חוּטְּרַיָא קֳדָם יְיָ בְּמַשְׁכְּנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא
verses.ar_en: Moshe placed the staffs before Adonoy in the Tent of the Testimony.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּיוֹמָא דְבַתְרוֹהִי וְעַאל משֶׁה לְמַשְׁכְּנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא וְהָא נְעָא חוּטְרָא דְאַהֲרֹן לְבֵית לְוֵי וְאַפֵּק לַבְלְבִין וְאָנֵץ נֵץ וְכָפֵית שִׁיגְדִין
verses.ar_en: It was on the next day, Moshe came inside the Tent of the Testimony, and behold! The staff of Aharon blossomed for the house of Levi, a blossom came forth, and bloomed buds and bore ripe almonds.

verses.ar_he: וְאַפֵיק משֶׁה יָת כָּל חוּטְרַיָא מִן קֳדָם יְיָ לְוָת כָּל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאִשְׁתְּמוֹדָעוּ וּנְסִיבוּ גְבַר חוּטְרֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: Moshe then brought out all the staffs from before Adonoy to all Bnei Yisroel, and each (man) saw [recognized], and retrieved his staff.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה אָתֵיב יַת חוּטְרָא דְאַהֲרֹן לְקֳדָם סַהֲדוּתָא לְמַטָרָא לְאָת לְעַמָא סַרְבָנָא וִיסוּפַן תּוּרְעֲמַתְהוֹן מִן קֳדָמַי וְלָא יְמוּתוּן
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Return the staff of Aharon before the (Ark of) Testimony to be preserved as a symbol to the rebellious people, so that their complaint will end [from before Me] and they not die.”

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד משֶׁה כְּמָא דִי פַקֵיד יְיָ יָתֵיה כֵּן עֲבָד
verses.ar_en: Moshe did (this), as Adonoy commanded him—so he did.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמשֶׁה לְמֵימָר הָא מִנָנָא קְטָלַת חַרְבָּא הָא מִנָנָא בְּלָעַת אַרְעָא וְהָא מִנָנָא דְמִיתוּ בְמוֹתָנָא
verses.ar_en: Bnei Yisroel said [the following] to Moshe: “Behold, we perish, we are lost—we are all lost [killed by sword, some of us swallowed by the earth, some of us perish by plague].

verses.ar_he: כֹּל דְקָרֵב מִקְרַב לְמַשְׁכְּנָא דַיְיָ מָאִית הָא אַנַחְנָא סַיְפִין לִמְמָת
verses.ar_en: Anyone approaching, who comes close to the Mishkon of Adonoy will die—have we been consigned to die?”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְאַהֲרֹן אַתְּ וּבְנָךְ וּבֵית אֲבוּךְ עִמָךְ תְּסַלְחוּן עַל חוֹבֵי מַקְדְשָׁא וְאַתְּ וּבְנָךְ עִמָךְ תְּסַלְחוּן עַל חוֹבֵי כְּהוּנַתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Aharon: “You, your sons, and your father’s house with you will bear the sin of the Sanctuary, and you, and your sons with you will bear the sin of your kehunah.

verses.ar_he: וְאַף יָת אֲחָיךְ שִׁבְטָא דְלֵוִי שִׁבְטָא דַאֲבוּךְ קָרֵיב לְוָתָךְ וְיִתּוֹסְפוּן עֲלָךְ וִישַׁמְשׁוּנָךְ וְאַתְּ וּבְנָךְ עִמָךְ קֳדָם מַשְׁכְּנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא
verses.ar_en: Also, your brothers, the tribe of Levi—the tribe of your father—bring to you, and they shall join you, and serve you, you and your sons with you, before the Tent of Testimony.

verses.ar_he: וְיִטְרוּן מַטַרְתָּךְ וּמַטְרַת כָּל מַשְׁכְּנָא בְּרַם לְמָנֵי קוּדְשָׁא וּלְמַדְבְּחָא לָא יִקְרְבוּן וְלָא יְמוּתוּן אַף אִינוּן אַף אַתּוּן
verses.ar_en: They shall guard their duties to you and all the duties of the Tent, but to the holy furniture or to the Altar they must not approach, that neither they, nor you, shall die.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתּוֹסְפוּן עֲלָךְ וְיִטְרוּן יָת מַטְרַת מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא לְכָל פּוּלְחַן מַשְׁכְּנָא וְחִילוֹנֵי לָא יִקְרַב לְוָתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: They shall join you and guard the duties of the Tent of Meeting—all the service of the Tent, but a commoner, [a non-kohein] should not approach you.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְרוּן יָת מַטְרַת קוּדְשָׁא וְיָת מַטְרַת מַדְבְּחָא וְלָא יְהֵי עוֹד רוּגְזָא עַל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: You shall discharge the sacred duties and the duties of the Altar, so that there will be no more wrath on Bnei Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲנָא הָא קְרֵיבִית יָת אֲחֵיכוֹן לֵוָאֵי מִגוֹ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכוֹן מַתְּנָא יְהִיבִין קֳדָם יְיָ לְמִפְלַח יָת פּוּלְחַן מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: Behold, I have brought your brothers the Levites from among Bnei Yisroel, given to you as a gift—for [before] Adonoy—to perform the work of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְּ וּבְנָךְ עִמָךְ תִּטְרוּן יָת כְּהוּנַתְכוֹן לְכָל פִּתְגַם מַדְבְּחָא וּלְמִגָיו לְפָרוּכְתָּא וְתִפְלְחוּן פוּלְחַן מַתְּנָא אֵיהַב יָת כְּהוּנַתְכוֹן וְחִילוֹנֵי דְיִקְרַב יִתְקְטֵיל
verses.ar_en: You and your sons with you shall guard your kehunah [duties] regarding the Altar and all that is within the Curtain—you shall serve—the service, as a gift, I give the kehunah to you, and the commoner who approaches shall be killed.”

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵיל יְיָ עִם אַהֲרֹן וַאֲנָא הָא יְהָבִית לָךְ יָת מַטְרַת אַפְרָשׁוּתָי לְכָל קוּדְשַׁיָא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לָךְ יְהַבְתִּינוּן לִרְבוּ וְלִבְנָךְ לִקְיָם עֲלָם
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Aharon: “Behold I have given you the guarding of my terumah-gifts, and all the hallowed things of Bnei Yisroel, to you and your children I give them for consecration, as a portion forever.

verses.ar_he: דֵין יְהֵי לָךְ מִקוֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשַׁיָא מוֹתַר מִן אֶשָׁתָא כָּל קוּרְבַּנְהוֹן לְכָל מִנְחַתְהוֹן וּלְכָל חַטְוַתְהוֹן וּלְכָל אֲשַׁמְהוֹן דִי יְתִיבוּן קֳדָמַי קוֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין דִילָךְ הִיא וְלִבְנָךְ
verses.ar_en: This is yours from the most holy [that remain] from the fire, [of] all their sacrifices—their minchah-offerings, their sin-offerings and their guilt-offerings which they return to [before] Me shall be most holy to you and your sons.

verses.ar_he: בְּקֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין תֵּיכְלוּנֵיהּ כָּל דְכוּרָא יֵיכוֹל יָתֵיהּ קוּדְשָׁא יְהֵי לָךְ
verses.ar_en: You shall eat it in the supremely holy (place), every male may eat it—it shall be holy to you.

verses.ar_he: וְדֵין לָךְ אַפְרָשׁוּת מַתְּנַתְהוֹן לְכָל אֲרָמוּת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לָךְ יְהַבְתִּינוּן וְלִבְנָיךְ וְלִבְנְתָיךְ עִמָךְ לִקְיַם עֲלָם כָּל דִדְכֵי בְּבֵיתָךְ יֵיכוֹל יָתֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: Their terumah-gift is yours, of all of the wave-offerings of Bnei Yisroel I give to you and to your sons and daughters that are with you as an everlasting portion; all those ritually pure in your house may eat it.

verses.ar_he: כָּל טוּב מְשַׁח וְכָל טוּב חֲמַר וְעִבּוּר רֵאשִׁיתְהוֹן דִי יִתְּנוּן קֳדָם יְיָ לָךְ יְהַבְתִּינוּן
verses.ar_en: The best of the oil, and the best of the wine and grain—their terumah-gift that they present to Adonoy—I have given to you.

verses.ar_he: בִּכּוּרֵי כָּל דִי בְאַרְעֲהוֹן דִי יַיְתוּן קֳדָם יְיָ דִילָךְ יְהֵי כָּל דִדְכֵי בְּבֵיתָךְ יֵיכְלִנֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: The first fruits of all that is in their land, which they bring before Adonoy, shall be yours; all those ritually pure in your house may eat it.

verses.ar_he: כָּל חֶרְמָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל דִילָךְ יְהֵי
verses.ar_en: Everything consecrated in Israel shall be yours.

verses.ar_he: כָּל פְּתַח וַלְדָא לְכָל בִּשְׂרָא דִי יְקָרְבוּן קֳדָם יְיָ בֶּאֱנָשָׁא וּבִבְעִירָא יְהֵי לָךְ בְּרַם מִפְרַק תִּפְרוֹק יָת בּוּכְרָא דֶאֱנָשָׁא וְיָת בּוּכְרָא דִבְעִירָא מְסַאֲבָא תִּפְרוֹק
verses.ar_en: Every firstling [all that open the womb] of every being which they offer before Adonoy—man or beast—shall be yours; but you must redeem the firstborn of man and redeem the firstborn of unclean beasts.

verses.ar_he: וּפוּרְקָנֵיהּ מִבַּר יַרְחָא תִּפְרוֹק בְּפוּרְסָנֵיהּ כְּסַף חַמְשָׁא סִלְעִין בְּסִלְעֵי קוּדְשָׁא עַשְׂרִין מָעִין הוּא
verses.ar_en: Its redemption—from a month old you should redeem them—the valuation is five silver sela’im of holy silver shekalim which is twenty gerah.

verses.ar_he: בְּרַם בּוּכְרָא דְתוֹרָא אוֹ בּוּכְרָא דְאִמְרָא אוֹ בּוּכְרָא דְעִזָא לָא תִפְרוֹק קוּדְשָׁא אִינוּן יָת דִמְהוֹן תִּזְרוֹק עַל מַדְבְּחָא וְיָת תַּרְבְּהוֹן תַּסֵיק קוּרְבַּן לְאִתְקַבָּלָא בְּרַעֲוָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: However, a firstborn ox, a firstborn sheep or firstborn goat do not redeem because they are holy; sprinkle their blood on the altar and burn their fats as a fire-offering as a pleasing fragrance to [accepted with pleasure before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּבִשְׂרְהוֹן יְהֵי לָךְ כְּחַדְיָא דַאֲרָמוּתָא וּכְשַׁקָא דְיַמִינָא דִילָךְ יְהֵי
verses.ar_en: Their flesh is yours; like the breast which is waved and like the right thigh—it shall be yours.

verses.ar_he: כָּל אַפְרָשׁוּת קוּדְשַׁיָא דִי יִפְרְשׁוּן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל קֳדָם יְיָ יְהָבִית לָךְ וְלִבְנָיךְ וְלִבְנָתָיךְ עִמָךְ לִקְיַם עֲלָם קְיַים מְלַח עֲלָם הִיא קֳדָם יְיָ לָךְ וְלִבְנָךְ עִמָךְ
verses.ar_en: All of the sacred terumah-gifts that Bnei Yisroel offer to Adonoy, I have given to you, your sons and daughters with you as an everlasting portion; an eternal covenant of salt before Adonoy to you and your children that are with you.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְאַהֲרֹן בְּאַרְעֲהוֹן לָא תַחֲסִין וְחוּלַק לָא יְהֵי לָךְ בֵּינֵיהוֹן מַתְּנָן דִי יְהָבִית לָךְ אִנוּן חוּלְקָךְ וְאַחֲסַנְתָּךְ בְּגוֹ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Aharon: “You will have no inheritance in their land, and you will not have a share among them; I am [the gift that I have given you is] your inheritance and portion among Bnei Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וְלִבְנֵי לֵוִי הָא יְהָבִית כָּל מַעַשְׂרָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לְאַחֲסָנָא חֲלַף פּוּלְחַנְהוֹן דִי אִינוּן פָּלְחִין יָת פּוּלְחַן מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: Behold, I have given to the sons of Levi all the tithes in Israel for an inheritance in return for their service which they perform—the service of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא יִקְרְבוּן עוֹד בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא לְקַבָּלָא חוֹבָא לִמְמָת
verses.ar_en: Bnei Yisroel shall no longer approach the Tent of Meeting, to become guilty and die.

verses.ar_he: וְיִפְלְחוּן לֵוָאֵי אִינוּן יָת פּוּלְחַן מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְאִינוּן יְקַבְּלוּן חוֹבֵיהוֹן קְיַם עֲלָם לְדָרֵיכוֹן וּבְגוֹ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא יַחְסְנוּן אַחְסָנָא
verses.ar_en: The Levi[tes]—[they] shall perform the service of the Tent of Meeting and they will bear their guilt; it is an everlasting decree—throughout your generations—among Bnei Yisroel they (the Levites) shall have no inheritance.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יָת מַעַשְׂרָא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל דִי יִפְרְשׁוּן קֳדָם יְיָ אַפְרָשׁוּתָא יְהָבִית לְלֵוָאֵי לְאַחֲסָנָא עַל כֵּן אֲמָרִית לְהוֹן בְּגוֹ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא יַחְסְנוּן אַחֲסָנָא
verses.ar_en: For the tithe of Bnei Yisroel which they must set aside to [before] Adonoy as a terumah-gift I gave to the Levites as an inheritance; therefore, I told them: ‘among Bnei Yisroel they shall have no inheritance.’”

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: וּלְלֵוָאֵי תְּמַלֵיל וְתֵימַר לְהוֹן אֲרֵי תִסְבוּן מִן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת מַעַשְׂרָא דִי יְהָבִית לְכוֹן מִנְהוֹן בְּאַחֲסַנְתְּכוֹן וְתַפְרְשׁוּן מִנֵיהּ אַפְרָשׁוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ מַעַשְׂרָא מִן מַעַשְׂרָא
verses.ar_en: “Speak to the Levites and say to them: ‘When you take the tithe from Bnei Yisroel, which I gave you from them for your inheritance, set aside from it the terumah-gift of [separation before] Adonoy, a tithe of the tithe.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתְחַשֵׁב לְכוֹן אַפְרָשׁוּתְכוֹן כְּעִבּוּרָא מִן אִדְרָא וְכִמְלֵאָתָא מִן מַעְצַרְתָּא
verses.ar_en: Your terumah-gift [separation] will be considered the same as grain from the granary and [wine and oil of] fully ripened fruit from the cistern.

verses.ar_he: כֵּן תַּפְרְשׁוּן אַף אַתּוּן אַפְרָשׁוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ מִכֹּל מַעַשְׂרָתֵיכוֹן דִי תִסְבוּן מִן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתִתְּנוּן מִנֵיהּ יָת אַפְרָשׁוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ לְאַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנָא
verses.ar_en: So must you, too, set aside the terumah-gift of Adonoy from all your tithes which you take from Bnei Yisroel; give from them the terumah-gift of [separation before] Adonoy to Aharon the kohein.

verses.ar_he: מִכֹּל מַתְּנָתֵכוֹן תִּפְרְשׁוּן יָת כָּל אַפְרָשׁוּתָא דַיְיָ מִכָּל שׁוּפְרֵיהּ יָת מַקְדְשֵׁיהּ מִנֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: From all your gifts you must set aside all of the terumah-gifts [separations] of Adonoy; from each thing—its finest part—the part that is to be consecrated.’

verses.ar_he: וְתֵימַר לְהוֹן בְּאַפְרָשׁוּתְכוֹן יָת שׁוּפְרֵיהּ מִנֵיהּ וְיִתְחַשֵׁב לְלֵּוָאֵי כַּעֲלָלַת אִדְרָא וְכַעֲלָלַת מַעֲצַרְתָּא
verses.ar_en: Say to them: ‘When you set aside the finest part of it, it will be considered for the Levites like the produce of the granary and the produce of the cistern.

verses.ar_he: וְתֵיכְלוּן יָתֵיהּ בְּכָל אֲתַר אַתּוּן וֶאֱנַשׁ בָּתֵּיכוֹן אֲרֵי אַגְרָא הוּא לְכוֹן חֲלַף פָּלְחַנְכוֹן בְּמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: You may consume it anywhere—you and [the members of] your household; since it is the reward for your service in the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא תְקַבְּלוּן עֲלוֹהִי חוֹבָא בְּאַפְרָשׁוּתְכוֹן יָת שׁוּפְרֵיהּ מִנֵיהּ וְיָת קוּדְשַׁיָא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא תְחַלְלוּן וְלָא תְמוּתוּן
verses.ar_en: You will not bear a sin because of it, when you separate its best part; but sacred things of Bnei Yisroel you must not profane, and you will not die.”’

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה וְעִם אַהֲרֹן לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe and Aharon, saying.

verses.ar_he: דָא גְזֵירַת אוֹרַיְתָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ לְמֵימָר מַלֵיל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיִסְבוּן לָךְ תּוֹרְתָא סִמוּקְתָּא שְׁלֶמְתָּא דִי לֵית בָּהּ מוּמָא דְלָא סְלִיק עֲלַהּ נִירָא
verses.ar_en: This is the statute of the Torah which Adonoy commanded, saying; speak to Bnei Yisroel that they shall take to you a red, perfect cow without a blemish, upon which no yoke was laid.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתְּנוּן יָתַהּ לְאֶלְעָזָר כַּהֲנָא וְיַפֵּק יָתַהּ לְמִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא וְיִכּוֹס יָתַהּ קֳדָמוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Give it to Elozor the kohein; he shall take it outside the camp, and someone shall slaughter it in his presence.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסַב אֶלְעָזָר כַּהֲנָא מִדְמַהּ בְּאֶצְבְּעֵיהּ וְיַדֵי לָקֳבֵל אַפֵּי מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא מִדְמַהּ שְׁבַע זִמְנִין
verses.ar_en: Elozor the kohein shall take some of its blood with his finger and sprinkle it directly facing the Tent of Meeting, some of its blood seven times.

verses.ar_he: וְיוֹקֵד יָת תּוֹרְתָא לְעֵינוֹהִי יָת מַשְׁכַּהּ וְיָת בִּשְׂרַהּ וְיָת דְמַהּ עַל אָכְלַהּ יוֹקֵיד
verses.ar_en: Someone shall burn the cow in his presence; its skin, flesh, blood, with its waste (that are in its intestines) shall be burned.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסַב כַּהֲנָא אָעָא דְאַרְזָא וְאֵזוֹבָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וְיִרְמֵי לְגוֹ יְקִידַת תּוֹרְתָא
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall take a piece of cedar wood, hyssop, and crimson wool, and throw them into the burning of the cow.

verses.ar_he: וִיצַבַּע לְבוּשׁוֹהִי כַּהֲנָא וְיַסְחֵי בִשְׂרֵיהּ בְמַיָא וּבָתַר כֵּן יֵיעוּל לְמַשְׁרִיתָא וִיהֵי מְסָאָב כַּהֲנָא עַד רַמְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: Then the kohein shall wash his garments and bathe his body in water, and afterwards he may enter the camp; [however,] the kohein shall be impure until the evening.

verses.ar_he: וּדְמוֹקֵד יָתַהּ יְצַבַּע לְבוּשׁוֹהִי בְּמַיָא וְיַסְחֵי בִשְׂרֵיהּ בְּמַיָא וִיהֵי מְסָאָב עַד רַמְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: Also, the one who burns it must wash his garments and bathe his body in water; he shall remain unclean until the evening.

verses.ar_he: וְיִכְנוֹשׁ גְבַר דְכֵי יָת קִטְמָא דְתוֹרְתָא וְיַצְנַע לְמִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא בַּאֲתַר דְכֵי וּתְהֵי לִכְנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמַטָּרָא לְמֵי אַדָיוּתָא חַטָאתָא הִיא
verses.ar_en: A ritually clean person shall gather the cow’s ashes and place [it] outside the camp in a clean place; it shall remain a keepsake for the community of Bnei Yisroel for sprinkling water for purification.

verses.ar_he: וִיצַבַּע דְכַנֵישׁ יָת קִטְמָא דְתוֹרְתָא יָת לְבוּשׁוֹהִי וִיהֵי מְסָאָב עַד רַמְשָׁא וּתְהֵי לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וּלְגִיוֹרַיָא דְיִתְגַיְירוּן בֵּינֵיהוֹן לִקְיַים עֲלָם
verses.ar_en: The one who gathers the cow’s ashes shall wash his garments, and remain unclean until the evening; it shall be for Bnei Yisroel and for the proselyte who lives among them an eternal statute.

verses.ar_he: דְיִקְרַב בְּמִיתָא לְכָל נַפְשָׁא דֶאֱנָשָׁא וִיהֵי מְסָאָב שַׁבְעָא יוֹמִין
verses.ar_en: One who touches the corpse of any [human] soul shall become unclean for seven days.

verses.ar_he: הוּא יַדֵי עֲלוֹהִי בְּיוֹמָא תְלִיתָאָה וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה יִדְכֵּי וְאִם לָא יַדֵי עֲלוֹהִי בְּיוֹמָא תְלִיתָאָה וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה לָּא יִדְכֵּי
verses.ar_en: He shall cleanse himself [be sprinked] with it on the third day and on the seventh day, so that he may become clean; if he does not have himself cleansed [be sprinked] on the third day and on the seventh day, he will not become clean.

verses.ar_he: כָּלּ דְיִקְרַבּ בְּמִיתָא בְּנַפְשָׁא דֶאֱנָשָׁא דִי יְמוּת וְלָא יַדֵי עֲלוֹהִי יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא דַיְיָ סָאֵב וְיִשְׁתֵּצֵי אֱנָשָׁא הַהוּא מִיִשְׂרָאֵל אֲרֵי מֵי אַדָיוּתָא לָא אִזְדְרִיקוּ עֲלוֹהִי מְסָאָב יְהֵי עוֹד סְאוֹבְתֵּיהּ בֵּיהּ
verses.ar_en: Whoever touches a corpse of a [human] soul, who died and does not have himself cleansed [be sprinked] defiles the Mishkan of Adonoy (if he enters it), that soul will be cut off from Yisroel; because the sprinkling water was not sprinkled on him, he will be impure his impurity remains.

verses.ar_he: דָא אוֹרַיְתָא אֱנַשׁ אֲרֵי יְמוּת בְּמַשְׁכְּנָא כָּל דְעָלֵל לְמַשְׁכְּנָא וְכָל דִי בְמַשְׁכְּנָא יְהֵי מְסָאָב שַׁבְעָא יוֹמִין
verses.ar_en: This is the law [regarding] a person who dies in a tent; anyone who enters the tent and everything that is in the tent shall be unclean for seven days.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל מַן דַחֲסַף פְּתִיחַ דְלֵית מִגוּפַת שְׁיִיעַ מַקַף עַלוֹהִי מְסָאָב הוּא
verses.ar_en: Any open [earthenware] utensil that has no cover fastened to it, shall be unclean.

verses.ar_he: וְכֹל דִי יִקְרַב עַל אַפֵּי חַקְלָא בִּקְטֵל חַרְבָּא אוֹ בְמִיתָא אוֹ בְגַרְמָא דֶאֱנָשָׁא אוֹ בְקִבְרָא יְהֵי מְסָאָב שַׁבְעָא יוֹמִין
verses.ar_en: Anyone who touches, in an open field, one slain by the sword, a corpse, human bone, or grave, shall be unclean for seven days.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְבוּן לְדִמְסָאָב מֵעֲפַר יְקִידַת חַטָאתָא וְיִתֵּן עֲלוֹהִי מֵי מַבּוּעַ לְמָן
verses.ar_en: They shall take for the unclean person of the ashes from the burnt purification-offering and he shall place upon them living [spring] water in a vessel.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסַב אֵזוֹבָא וְיִטְבּוֹל בְּמַיָא גְבַר דְכֵי וְיַדֵי עַל מַשְׁכְּנָא וְעַל כָּל מָנַיָא וְעַל נַפְשָׁתָא דִי הֲווֹ תַמָן וְעַל דְיִקְרַב בְּגַרְמָא אוֹ בְקָטִילָא אוֹ בְמִיתָא אוֹ בְקִבְרָא
verses.ar_en: He shall take hyssop and dip it into the water; [this is done by] a ritually clean person, he shall sprinkle it on the tent, on all the utensils and people that were there, and on anyone who touched the bone, murder victim, corpse, or grave.

verses.ar_he: וְיַדֵי דַכְיָא עַל מְסָאֲבָא בְּיוֹמָא תְלִיתָאָה וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה וִידַכִּינֵיהּ בְּיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה וִיצַבַּע לְבּוּשׁוֹהִי וְיַסְחֵי בְמַיָא וְיִדְכֵּי בְרַמְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: The ritually clean person shall sprinkle upon the unclean person on the third day and on the seventh day; he shall purify him on the seventh day when he must wash his garments and bathe in water, and then he becomes clean in the evening.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יִסְתָּאֵב וְלָא יַדֵי עֲלוֹהִי וְיִשְׁתֵּיצֵי אֱנָשָׁא הַהוּא מִגוֹ קְהָלָא אֲרֵי יָת מַקְדְשָׁא דַיְיָ סָאֵיב מֵי אַדָיוּתָא לָא אִזְדְרִיקוּ עֲלוֹהִי מְסָאָבּ הוּא
verses.ar_en: A person who became ritually unclean [and enters the Sanctuary] without purifying himself [being sprinkled], that soul [person] will be cut off from the community; for he defiled the Sanctuary of Adonoy, the sprinkling water was not sprinkled upon him, he remains unclean.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי לְהוֹן לִקְיַם עֲלָם וּדְיַדֵי מֵי אַדָיוּתָא יְצַבַּע לְבוּשׁוֹהִי וּדְיִקְרַב בְּמֵי אַדָיוּתָא יְהֵי מְסָאָב עַד רַמְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: This shall be the statute for all times; one who sprinkles the sprinkling waters shall wash his garments, and one who touches the sprinkling waters shall remain unclean until the evening.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל דִי יִקְרַב בֵּיהּ מְסָאָבָא יְהֵי מְסָאָב וֶאֱנַשׁ דְיִקְרַב בֵּיהּ יְהֵי מְסָאָב עַד רַמְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: Anything which the unclean person touches, shall become unclean; and anyone touching him shall be ritually unclean until the evening.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתוֹ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָא לְמַדְבְּרָא דְצִין בְּיַרְחָא קַדְמָאָה וִיתֵיב עַמָא בִּרְקָם וּמִיתַת תַּמָן מִרְיָם וְאִתְקְבָרַת תַּמָן
verses.ar_en: The entire community of Bnei Yisroel came to the wilderness of Tzin, in the first month. The people settled in Kodeish [Rekom], and Miriam died and was buried there.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא הֲוָה מַיָא לִכְנִשְׁתָּא וְאִתְכַּנָשׁוּ עַל משֶׁה וְעַל אַהֲרֹן
verses.ar_en: There was no water for the community, and they assembled against Moshe and Aharon.

verses.ar_he: וּנְצָא עַמָא עִם משֶׁה וַאֲמָרוּ לְמֵימָר וּלְוַי דְמִתְנָא בְּמוֹתָא דַאֲחָנָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: The people quarreled with Moshe and said, “Would that we had died by our brothers’ death before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּלְמָא אַעֶלְתּוּן יָת קְהָלָא דַיְיָ לְמַדְבְּרָא הָדֵין לִמְמַת תַּמָן אֲנַחְנָא וּבְעִירָנָא
verses.ar_en: Why did you bring the congregation of Adonoy into this wilderness for us and our livestock to die there?

verses.ar_he: וּלְמָא אַסֶקְתּוּנָא מִמִצְרַיִם לְאַיְתָאָה יָתָנָא לְאַתְּרָא בִישָׁא הָדֵין לָא אֲתַר כְּשַׁר לְבֵית זְרַע וְאַף לָא תְּאֵנִין וְגוּפְנִין וְרִמוֹנִין וּמַיָא לֵית לְמִשְׁתֵּי
verses.ar_en: Why did you take us out of Egypt and bring us to this terrible place? It is not a place [fit] for seed, [nor for] figs, grapes, or pomegranates; and there is no water to drink!”

verses.ar_he: וְעַאל משֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן מִן קֳדָם קְהָלָא לִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וּנְפָלוּ עַל אַפֵּיהוֹן וְאִתְגְלֵי יְקָרָא דַיְיָ לְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Moshe and Aharon moved away from the assembly to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and fell on their faces; the glory of Adonoy appeared to them.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying.

verses.ar_he: סַב יָת חוּטְרָא וְאַכְנֵשׁ יָת כְּנִשְׁתָּא אַתְּ וְאַהֲרֹן אָחוּךְ וּתְמַלְלוּן עִם כֵּיפָא לְעֵינֵיהוֹן וְיִתֵּן מוֹהִי וְתַפֵּיק לְהוֹן מַיָא מִן כֵּיפָא וְתַשְׁקֵי יָת כְּנִשְׁתָּא וְיָת בְּעִירְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: “Take the staff and assemble the community, you and Aharon your brother, and speak to the rock in their presence that it may give forth its water; you will then bring forth for them water from the rock, and give drink [to] the community and their livestock.”

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב משֶׁה יָת חוּטְרָא מִן קֳדָם יְיָ כְּמָא דִי פַקְדֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: Moshe took the staff from before Adonoy, as He instructed him.

verses.ar_he: וְאַכְנִישׁוּ משֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן יָת קְהָלָא לְקֳדָם כֵּיפָא וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן שְׁמָעוּ כְעַן סַרְבָנַיָא הֲמִן כֵּיפָא הָדֵין נַפֵּיק לְכוֹן מַיָא
verses.ar_en: Moshe and Aharon assembled the community before the rock; [Moshe] said to them, “Listen, you rebels! Can we extract water from this rock for you?”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵם משֶׁה יָת יְדֵיהּ וּמְחָא יָת כֵּיפָא בְּחוּטְּרֵיהּ תְּרֵין זִמְנִין וּנְפָקוּ מַיָא סַגִיאֵי וּשְׁתִיאַת כְּנִשְׁתָּא וּבְעִירְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: And Moshe raised his hand and struck the rock with his staff twice; water rushed out abundantly, and the community and their livestock drank.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה וּלְאַהֲרֹן חֲלַף דִי לָא הֵימַנְתּוּן בְּמֵימְרִי לְקַדָשׁוּתִי לְעֵינֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּכֵן לָא תֵעֲלוּן יָת קְהָלָא הָדֵין לְאַרְעָא דִי יְהָבִית לְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe and Aharon, “Because you did not believe in Me [My word] to sanctify Me in the presence of Bnei Yisroel; therefore, you will not bring this congregation into the land that I have given them.”

verses.ar_he: אִינוּן מֵי מַצוּתָא דִנְצוֹ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל קֳדָם יְיָ וְאִתְקַדַשׁ בְּהוֹן
verses.ar_en: They are the waters of dispute where Bnei Yisroel contended with [before] Adonoy, and He was sanctified through them.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁלַח משֶׁה אִזְגַדִין מֵרְקָם לְוַת מַלְכָּא דֶאֱדוֹם כִּדְנַן אֲמַר אָחוּךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל אַתְּ יְדַעְתְּ יָת כָּל עָקְתָא דִי אַשְׁכַּחְתָּנָא
verses.ar_en: Moshe sent emissaries from Kodeish [Rekom] to the King of Edom (saying), “This is what your brother Yisroel declares; you know of all the hardship that we have encountered.

verses.ar_he: וּנְחָתוּ אֲבָהָתָנָא לְמִצְרַיִם וִיתֵיבְנָא בְמִצְרַיִם יוֹמִין סַגִיאִין וְאַבְאִישׁוּ לָנָא מִצְרָאֵי וְלַאֲבָהָתָנָא
verses.ar_en: Our forefathers went down to Egypt and we remained in Egypt for a long time; the Egyptians mistreated us and our forefathers.

verses.ar_he: וְצַלֵינָא קֳדָם יְיָ וְקַבִּיל צְלוֹתָנָא וּשְׁלַח מַלְאָכָא וְאַפְקָנָא מִמִצְרָיִם וְהָא אֲנַחְנָא בִּרְקַם קַרְתָּא דְבִסְטַר תְּחוּמָךְ
verses.ar_en: Then we cried out [prayed] to Adonoy, and He heard our voice [accept our prayer], He sent an emissary and led us out of Egypt; now we are in Kodeish [Rekom], a city at the edge of your border.

verses.ar_he: נְעִיבַּר כְּעַן בְּאַרְעָךְ לָא נְעִיבֵּר בַּחֲקַל וּבִכְרָם וְלָא נִשְׁתֵּי מֵי גוֹב בְּאֹרַח מַלְכָּא נֵיזֵיל לָא נִסְטֵּי לְיַמִינָא וְלִשְׂמָאלָא עַד דִנְעִיבַּר תְּחוּמָךְ
verses.ar_en: Please let us pass through your land, we will not pass through any field or vineyard, and we will not drink well water; we will travel by the king’s road, we will not turn aside to the right or left, until we have passed through your territory.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ אֱדוֹמָאָה לָא תְעִבַּר בִּתְחוּמִי דִלְמָא בִדְקָטְלִין בְּחַרְבָּא אֶפּוֹק לָקָדָמוּתָךְ
verses.ar_en: Edom responded, “You shall not pass through me (my land) [my border], lest I go out against you [to kill you] with the sword!”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ לֵיהּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּאֹרַח כְּבִישָׁא נִסַק וְאִם מֵימַךְ נִשְׁתֵּי אֲנָא וּבְעִירַי וְאֶתֵּן דְמֵיהוֹן לְחוֹד לֵית פִּתְגַם דְבִישׁ בְּרַגְלַי אֵעִיבַּר
verses.ar_en: Bnei Yisroel said, “We will go up by the [paved] highway, and if we or our cattle drink your water we will pay for it, it is just nothing, we only want [with no evil intent] to pass through on foot.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לָא תְעִבָּר וּנְפַק אֱדוֹמָאָה לָקֳדָמוּתֵיהּ בְּחֵיל רַב וּבִידָא תַקִיפָא
verses.ar_en: Then (Edom) responded, “Do not pass through!” Edom came to confront [Bnei Yisroel] with a massive number of people [an army] and a strong hand.

verses.ar_he: וְסָרֵיב אֱדוֹמָאָה לְמִשְׁבַּק יָת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֶעֱבַר בִּתְחוּמֵיהּ וּסְטָּא יִשְׂרָאֵל מִלְוָתֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: Edom refused to allow Yisroel to pass through its territory, and Yisroel turned aside from him.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטָלוּ מֵרְקָם וַאֲתוֹ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא לְהֹר טוּרָא
verses.ar_en: They traveled from Kodeish, and the entire community of Bnei Yisroel came to Mount Hor.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה וּלְאַהֲרֹן בְּהוֹר טוּרָא עַל תְּחוּם אַרְעָא דֶאֱדוֹם לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe and Aharon at Mount Hor, at the border of the land of Edom, saying.

verses.ar_he: יִתְכְּנֵשׁ אַהֲרֹן לְעַמֵיהּ אֲרֵי לָא יֵעוֹל לְאַרְעָא דִי יְהָבִית לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל דִי סְרֵיבְתּוּן עַל מֵימְרִי לְמֵי מַצוּתָא
verses.ar_en: “Aharon will now be gathered (die) to his people, for he shall not enter the land that I have given to Bnei Yisroel, because you defied My word at the waters of dispute.

verses.ar_he: דְבַר יָת אַהֲרֹן וְיָת אֶלְעָזָר בְּרֵיהּ וְאַסֵיק יָתְהוֹן לְהֹר טּוּרָא
verses.ar_en: Take Aharon and his son Elozor, and bring them up to Mount Hor.

verses.ar_he: וְאַשְׁלַח יָת אַהֲרֹן יָת לְבוּשׁוֹהִי וְתַלְבֵּישִׁנוּן יָת אֶלְעָזָר בְּרֵיהּ וְאַהֲרֹן יִתְכְּנֵישׁ וִימוּת תַּמָן
verses.ar_en: Remove Aharon’s vestments and dress his son Elozor in them; Aharon will be gathered in and die there.”

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד משֶׁה כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ וּסְלִיקוּ לְהֹר טוּרָא לְעֵינֵי כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא
verses.ar_en: Moshe did as Adonoy commanded; and they went up Mount Hor in the presence of the entire community.

verses.ar_he: וְאַשְׁלַח משֶׁה יָת אַהֲרֹן יָת לְבוּשׁוֹהִי וְאַלְבִּישׁ יָתְהוֹן יָת אֶלְעָזָר בְּרֵיהּ וּמִית אַהֲרֹן תַּמָן בְּרֵישׁ טוּרָא וּנְחַת משֶׁה וְאֶלְעָזָר מִן טוּרָא
verses.ar_en: Moshe then removed Aharon’s vestments and dressed Aharon’s son, Elozor, in them; Aharon died there on top of the mountain, and Moshe and Elozor descended from the mountain.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזוֹ כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא אֲרֵי מִית אַהֲרֹן וּבְכוֹ יָת אַהֲרֹן תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין כֹּל בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: The entire community saw that Aharon died; and they wept for Aharon thirty days, the entire house of Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁמַע כְּנַעֲנָאָה מַלְכָּא דַעֲרָד יָתֵיב דָרוֹמָא אֲרֵי אֲתָא יִשְׂרָאֵל אֹרַח מְאַלְלַיָא וְאַגַח קְרָבָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וּשְׁבָא מִנֵיהּ שִׁבְיָא
verses.ar_en: The Canaanite King of Arad heard—who lived in the south—that Yisroel had come by the route of the spies; he attacked [waged war with] Yisroel, and he took from them a captive.

verses.ar_he: וְקַיֵים יִשְׂרָאֵל קְיָים קֳדָם יְיָ וַאֲמַר אִם מִמְסַר תִּמְסַר יָת עַמָא הָדֵין בִּידִי וַאֲגַמַר יָת קִרְוֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Yisroel made a vow to [before] Adonoy and said, “If You will deliver this people into my hand, I shall consecrate their cities.”

verses.ar_he: וְקַבֵּיל יְיָ צְלוֹתֵיהּ דְיִשְׂרָאֵל וּמְסַר יָת כְּנַעֲנָאָה וְגַמַר יָתְהוֹן וְיָת קִרְוֵיהוֹן וּקְרָא שְׁמָא דְאַתְרָא חָרְמָה
verses.ar_en: Adonoy heard Yisroel’s voice [prayers], and He delivered the Canaanites (into Yisroel’s hand), and he (Yisroel) destroyed them and [consecrated] their cities; the region was named Chormo.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטָלוּ מֵהֹר טוּרָא אֹרַח יַמָא דְסוּף לְאַקָפָא יָת אַרְעָא דֶאֱדוֹם וַעֲקַת נַפְשָׁא דְעַמָא בְּאוֹרְחָא
verses.ar_en: They then traveled from Mount Hor by the Reed Sea route, in order to circle around the land of Edom; traveling was insufferable to the [soul of the] people.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְרַעַם עַמָא בְּמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ וְעִם משֶׁה נְצוֹ לְמָא אַסֵקְתּוּנָא מִמִצְרַיִם לִמְמָת בְּמַדְבְּרָא אֲרֵי לֵית לַחְמָא וְלֵית מַיָא וְנַפְשָׁנָא עָקַת בְּמַנָא הָדֵין דְמֵיכְלֵיהּ קָלֵיל
verses.ar_en: The people spoke out [complained] against [the word of] God and [they fought] Moshe, “Why did you bring us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? There is no food and no water, and we are disgusted with this rotten bread [which is eaten simply].”

verses.ar_he: וְגָרֵי יְיָ בְּעַמָא יָת חִיוַן קָלָן וּנְכִיתוּ יָת עַמָא וּמִית עַם סַגִי מִיִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: Adonoy sent against the people the consuming snakes, and they bit the people, and many people of Yisroel died.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתָא עַמָא לְמשֶׁה וַאֲמָרוּ חַבְנָא אֲרֵי אִתְרַעַמְנָא קֳדָם יְיָ וְעִמָךְ נְצֵינָא צַלִי קֲדָם יְיָ וְיַעֲדִי מִנָנָא יָת חִוְיָא וְצַלִי משֶׁה עַל עַמָא
verses.ar_en: The people came to Moshe and said, “We have sinned by speaking against [complaining before] Adonoy and [fighting with] you; pray to [before] Adonoy that He remove the snakes from us.” Moshe prayed on behalf of the people.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה עֲבֵיד לָךְ קַלְיָא וְשַׁוִי יָתֵיהּ עַל אָת וִיהֵי כָּל דְיִתְנְכִית וְיֶחֱזֵי יָתֵהּ וְיִתְקַיָם
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Make yourself [the image of] a consuming snake, and place it upon a banner; and anyone bitten will look at it and live.”

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד משֶׁה חִוְיָא דִנְחָשָׁא וְשַׁוְיֵהּ עַל אָת וַהֲוָה כַּד נְכֵית חִוְיָא יָת גַבְרָא וּמִסְתַּכֵּל לְחִוְיָא דִנְחָשָׁא וּמִתְקַיָם
verses.ar_en: Moshe made a copper snake and placed it on the banner; whenever a snake bit a person, he would gaze upon the copper snake and live.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטָלוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וּשְׁרוֹ בְּאוֹבוֹת
verses.ar_en: Bnei Yisroel traveled on and camped in Ovos.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטָלוּ מֵאוֹבוֹת וּשְׁרוֹ בִמְגִיזַת עֲבָרָאֵי בְּמַדְבְּרָא דִי עַל אַפֵּי מוֹאָב מִמַדְנַח שִׁמְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: They traveled from Ovos and camped in the wasteland passes in the wilderness, facing Moav, eastward of the sun.

verses.ar_he: מִתַּמָן נְטָלוּ וּשְׁרוֹ בְּנַחֲלָא דְזָרֶד
verses.ar_en: They traveled from there and camped in the valley of Zered.

verses.ar_he: מִתַּמָן נְטָלוּ וּשְׁרוֹ מֵעִבְרָא דְאַרְנוֹן דִי בְּמַדְבְּרָא דְנָפֵיק מִתְּחוּם אֱמוֹרָאָה אֲרֵי אַרְנוֹן תְּחוּם מוֹאָב בֵּין מוֹאָב וּבֵין אֱמוֹרָאָה
verses.ar_en: They traveled from there and camped opposite Arnon, in the wilderness, extending from the Emorite border; Arnon being the Moav border between Moav and the Emorite.

verses.ar_he: עַל כֵּן יִתְאַמַר בְּסִפְרָא קְרָבִין דַעֲבַד יְיָ עַל יַמָא דְסוּף וּגְבוּרָן דְעַל נַחֲלֵי אַרְנוֹן
verses.ar_en: Concerning this will be told in the Book of the Wars of Adonoy, “He gave at the Reeds (Sea) and [the might at] the valleys of Arnon.

verses.ar_he: וְשָׁפוּךְ נַחֲלַיָא דְמִדַבְּרִין לְקָבֵל לְחָיַת וּמִסְתְּמִיךְ לִתְחוּם מוֹאָב
verses.ar_en: And the spillage in the valleys when it turned to dwell at Ar, and then leaned on the border of Moav.

verses.ar_he: וּמִתַּמָן אִתְיְהִיבַת לְהוֹן בֵּירָא הִיא בֵירָא דִי אֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה כְּנוֹשׁ יָת עַמָא וְאֶתֵּן לְהוֹן מַיָא
verses.ar_en: From there, to the well; this is the well of which Adonoy said to Moshe, ‘Gather the people and I will give them water.’”

verses.ar_he: בְּכֵן שַׁבַּח יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת תּוּשְׁבַּחְתָּא הָדָא סַקִי בֵירָא שַׁבָּחוּ לָהּ
verses.ar_en: It was then that Yisroel sang this song [of praise]: “Arise, O well, sing to it!

verses.ar_he: בֵּירָא דְחָפְרוּהָ רַבְרְבַיָא כְּרוּהָ רֵישֵׁי עַמָא סַפְרַיָא בְּחוּטְרֵיהוֹן וּמִמַדְבְּרָא אִתְיְהִיבַת לְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: The well dug by princes, that the nobles of the nation excavated, through the lawgiver, with their staffs; from the wilderness a gift [was given to them].

verses.ar_he: וּמִדְאִתְיְהִיבַת לְהוֹן נַחֲתָא עִמְהוֹן לְנַחֲלַיָא וּמִנַחֲלַיָא סָלְקָא עִמְהוֹן לְרָמָתָא
verses.ar_en: The gift [given to them] (traveled) to the valley, and from the valley [rose with them] to the heights.

verses.ar_he: וּמֵרָמָתָא לְחֵילַיָא דִי בְּחַקְלֵי מוֹאָב רֵישׁ רָמָתָא וּמִסְתַּכְיָא עַל אַפֵּי בֵּית יְשִׁימוֹן
verses.ar_en: And from the heights to the valley that is in the field of Moav, at the top of the peak that overlooks the wastelands.”

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁלַח יִשְׂרָאֵל אִזְגַדִין לְוָת סִיחוֹן מַלְכָּא דֶאֱמוֹרָאָה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Yisroel sent emissaries to Sichon, King of the Emorite, saying.

verses.ar_he: אֵעִיבַּר בְּאַרְעָךְ לָא נִסְטֵי בַּחֲקַל וּבִכְרַם לָא נִשְׁתֵּי מֵי גוֹב בְּאֹרַח מַלְכָּא נֵיזֵיל עַד דִי נְעִבַּר תְּחוּמָךְ
verses.ar_en: “Let me pass through your land, we will not turn aside into the fields and vineyards, we will not drink well water; we will go by the King’s road until we have passed through your territory.”

verses.ar_he: וְלָא שְׁבַק סִיחוֹן יָת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֶעְבַּר בִּתְחוּמֵיהּ וּכְנַשׁ סִיחוֹן יָת כָּל עַמֵיהּ וּנְפַק לָקֳדָמוּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמַדְבְּרָא וַאֲתָא לְיָהַץ וְאַגִיחַ קְרָבָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: But Sichon did not allow Yisroel to pass through his territory; Sichon gathered all his people and went out against Yisroel to the wilderness; he came to Yohatz and attacked [waged war with] Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וּמְחָהִי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְפִתְגַם דְחָרֶב וִירֵת יָת אַרְעֵיהּ מֵאַרְנוֹנָא עַד יוּבְקָא עַד בְּנֵי עַמוֹן אֲרֵי תַקִיף תְּחוּמָא דִבְנֵי עַמוֹן
verses.ar_en: Yisroel defeated him with the edge of the sword and took possession of his land; from Arnon to the Yabok, as far as Amon[’s border], because Amon’s border was impregnable.

verses.ar_he: וּכְבַשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת כָּל קִרְוַיָא הָאִלֵין וִיתֵיב יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּכָל קִרְוֵי אֱמוֹרָאָה בְּחֶשְׁבּוֹן וּבְכָל כַּפְרָנָהָא
verses.ar_en: Yisroel took [captured] all these cities; Yisroel settled in all the cities of the Emorite, in Cheshbon and all its daughters [villages].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי חֶשְׁבּוֹן קַרְתָּא דְסִיחוֹן מַלְכָּא דֶאֱמוֹרָאָה הִיא וְהוּא אַגַח קְרָבָא בְּמַלְכָּא דְמוֹאָב קַדְמָאָה וּנְסֵיב יָת כָּל אַרְעֵיהּ מִידֵיהּ עַד אַרְנוֹן
verses.ar_en: For Cheshbon was then a city of Sichon, King of the Emorites, and he had waged war against the first king of Moav, and took all his land from his hand, as far as Arnon.

verses.ar_he: עַל כֵּן יֵימְרוּן מְתָלַיָא עוּלוּ לְחֶשְׁבּוֹן תִּתְבְּנֵי וְתִשְׁתַּכְלַל קַרְתָּא דְסִיחוֹן
verses.ar_en: Concerning this, the parable tellers say: “Come to Cheshbon, may it be built and established as the city of Sichon.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי קִידוּם תַּקִיף כְּאֶשָׁא נְפַק מֵחֶשְׁבּוֹן עָבְדֵי קְרָבָא כְּשַׁלְהוֹבִיתָא מִקַרְתָּא דְסִיחוֹן קַטִילוּ עַמָא דִשְׁרוֹ בִּלְחָיַת מוֹאָב כּוּמְרַיָא דְפַלְחִין בֵּית דַחֲלָא רָמָתָא דְאַרְנוֹן
verses.ar_en: For [an Easterly wind as strong as] a fire went forth from Cheshbon, [waged war as] a flame from Sichon’s capital; it consumed [killing the nation that dwelled in] Ar [Lechoyas], of Moav, [killing] the masters [priests who serve in the house of idol worship] of Arnon’s heights.

verses.ar_he: וַי לְכוֹן מוֹאֲבָאֵי אֲבַדְתּוּן עַמָא דְפָלְחִין לִכְמוֹשׁ מְסַר בְּנוֹהִי צִירִין וּבְנָתֵיהּ בְּשִׁבְיָא לְמַלְכָּא דֶאֱמוֹרָאָה סִיחוֹן
verses.ar_en: Woe to you, O Moav, you are destroyed, people of [who serve] Kemosh, he rendered your sons as refugees, and your daughters captives, of Sichon, King of Emori.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלְכוּ פְסָקַת מֵחֶשְׁבּוֹן עֲדָא שׁוּלְטַן מִדִיבוֹן וְצֲדִיאוּ עַד נֹפַח דִסְמִיךְ עַד מֵידְבָא
verses.ar_en: Their kingdom was uprooted from Cheshbon as far as Divon [whose reign has ended]; we made them desolate as far as Nofach near Meidva.”

verses.ar_he: וִיתֵב יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּאֲרַע אֱמוֹרָאָה
verses.ar_en: Yisroel settled in the land of the Emorite.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁלַח משֶׁה לְאַלָלָא יָת יַעְזֵר וּכְבָשׁוּ כַּפְרָנָהָא וְתָרִיךְ יָת אֱמוֹרָאָהּ דִי תַמָן
verses.ar_en: Moshe sent [men] to spy on Ya’zer, and they captured its surrounding villages, and drove out the Emorites that were there.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְפְּנִיאוּ וּסְלִיקוּ לְאֹרַח מַתְנָן וּנְפַק עוֹג מַלְכָּא דְמַתְנָן לְקֳדָמוּתְהוֹן הוּא וְכָל עַמֵּיהּ לְאַגָחָא קְרָבָא לְאֶדְרֶעִי
verses.ar_en: They then turned and headed toward the Bashan [Masnon]; and Og, King of the Bashan [Masnon], came out against them he with all his people, to wage war at Edre’i.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה לָא תִדְחַל מִנֵיהּ אֲרֵי בִידָךְ מְסָרִית יָתֵיהּ וְיָת כָּל עַמֵיהּ וְיָת אַרְעֵיהּ וְתַעֲבֵד לֵיהּ כְּמָא דִי עֲבַדְתְּ לְסִיחוֹן מַלְכָּא דֶאֱמוֹרָאָה דִי יָתֵב בְּחֶשְׁבּוֹן
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Do not be afraid of him, for into your hand I have delivered Ihim and all his people and territory; do to him as you have done to Sichon, King of the Emorite, who lives in Cheshbon.”

verses.ar_he: וּמְחוֹ יָתֵיהּ וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי וְיָת כָל עַמֵּיהּ עַד דְלָא אִשְׁתָּאַר לֵיהּ מְשֵׁיזִיב וִירִיתוּ יָת אַרְעֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: And they killed him (Og), his sons, and all his people, leaving no survivors; and they took possession of his land.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטָלוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וּשְׁרוֹ בְּמֵישְׁרַיָא דְמוֹאָב מֵעִבְרָא לְיַרְדְנָא דִירֵחוֹ
verses.ar_en: Bnei Yisroel traveled and camped in the western plains of Moav, across the Yardein from Yereicho.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא בָּלָק בַּר צִפּוֹר יָת כָּל דִי עֲבַד יִשְׂרָאֵל לֶאֱמוֹרָאֵי
verses.ar_en: And Balak the son of Tzipor saw all that Yisroel had done to the Emorite.

verses.ar_he: וּדְחִיל מוֹאֲבָאָה מִן קֳדָם עַמָא לַחֲדָא אֲרֵי סַגִי הוּא וַעֲקַת לְמוֹאֲבָאָה מִן קֳדָם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: And Moav became terrified of the people [of Israel] because of their great numbers, and so, Moav detested the Bnei Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר מוֹאָב לְסָבֵי מִדְיָן כְּעַן יְשֵׁיצוּן קְהָלָא יָת כָּל סַחֲרָנָנָא כְּמָא דִמְלַחֵיךְ תּוֹרָא יָת יְרוֹקָא דְחַקְלָא וּבָלָק בַּר צִפּוֹר מַלְכָּא לְמוֹאָב בְּעִידָנָה הַהִיא
verses.ar_en: Moav said to the elders of Midian, “Now this assembly will lick up [consume] everything around us, just as the ox laps up the herbs of the field.” Balak the son of Tzipor was King of Moav at that time.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁלַח אִזְגַדִין לְוָת בִּלְעָם בַּר בְּעוֹר לִפְּתוֹר אֲרָם דְעַל פְּרָת אֲרַע בְּנֵי עַמֵיהּ לְמִקְרֵי לֵיהּ לְמֵימָר הָא עַמָא נְפַק מִמִצְרַיִם הָא חֲפָא יַת עֵין שִׁמְשָׁא דְאַרְעָא וְהוּא שָׁרֵי מִלְקִבְלִי
verses.ar_en: He sent emissaries to Bil’am the son of Beor, to Pesor—which is by the river [Peras], the land of his people—to call him, saying: “Behold, a nation came out of Egypt, behold they have covered [obscured the sunshine from] the face of the earth, and is located across from me.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן אִיתָא כְּעַן לוֹט לִי יָת עַמָא הָדֵין אֲרֵי תַקִיף הוּא מִנִי מָאִים אֵכוּל לְאַגָחָא בֵּיהּ קְרָב וַאֲתָרֵכִינֵיהּ מִן אַרְעָא אֲרֵי יְדַעֲנָא יָת דִי תְבָרַךְ מְבָרָךְ וְדִי תְלוֹט לִיט
verses.ar_en: And now, please come and curse this nation for me, for it is too mighty for me, perhaps it will enable us to strike at [wage war with] him, and banish them from the land; for I know, that whomever you bless is blessed, and whomever you curse is cursed.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲזָלוּ סָבֵי מוֹאָב וְסָבֵי מִדְיָן וְקִסְמַיָא בִּידֵיהוֹן וַאֲתוֹ לְוַת בִּלְעָם וּמַלִילוּ עִמֵיהּ פִּתְגָמֵי בָּלָק
verses.ar_en: And the elders of Moav and Midian went with magic charms in their hands; they came to Bil’am and conveyed Balak's message to him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן בִּיתוּ הָכָא בְּלֵילְיָא וְאָתֵב יַתְכוֹן פִּתְגָמָא כְּמָא דִי יְמַלֵיל יְיָ עִמִי וְאוֹרִיכוּ רַבְרְבֵי מוֹאָב עִם בִּלְעָם
verses.ar_en: He replied to them: “Spend this night here and then I will give you an answer according to what Adonoy tells me,’’ and the dignitaries of Moav remained with Bil’am.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתָא מֵימַר מִן קֳדָם יְיָ לְוַת בִּלְעָם וַאֲמַר מָן גוּבְרַיָא הָאִלֵין דְעִמָךְ
verses.ar_en: God[’s word] appeared to [before] Bil’am and said, “Who are these men with you?”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בִּלְעָם קֳדָם יְיָ בָּלָק בַּר צִפּוֹר מַלְכָּא דְמוֹאָב שְׁלַח לְוָתִי
verses.ar_en: Bil’am replied to God: “Balak son of Tzipor, King of Moav, has sent them to me [saying]:

verses.ar_he: הָא עַמָא דִי נְפַק מִמִצְרַיִם וַחֲפָא יָת עֵין שִׁמְשָׁא דְאַרְעָא כְּעַן אִיתָא לוֹט לִי יָתֵיהּ מָאִים אֵיכוּל לְאַגָחָא בֵּיהּ קְרָב וְאֲתָרֵיכִינֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: ‘Behold, the people that came out of Egypt has covered [obscured the sunshine from] the face of the earth; come now, and curse him for me so that I will be able to wage war against him, and banish him’.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְבִלְעָם לָא תֵיזִיל עִמְהוֹן לָא תְלוֹט יָת עַמָא אֲרֵי בְרִיךְ הוּא
verses.ar_en: God said to Bil’am: “Do not go with them! You shall not curse the people, for they are blessed.”

verses.ar_he: וְקָם בִּלְעָם בְּצַפְרָא וַאֲמַר לְרַבְרְבֵי בָלָק אִיזִילוּ לְאַרְעֲכוֹן אֲרֵי לֵית רַעֲוָא קֳדָם יְיָ לְמִשְׁבְּקִי לְמֵיזַל עִמְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Bil’am arose in the morning and said to Balak's dignitaries: “Go back to your land, for Adonoy refuses [it is not the will of Hashem] to allow me to go with you.”

verses.ar_he: וְקָמוּ רַבְרְבֵי מוֹאָב וַאֲתוֹ לְוָת בָּלָק וַאֲמָרוּ סָרֵיב בִּלְעָם לְמֵיתֵי עִמָנָא
verses.ar_en: Moav's dignitaries got up, and came to Balak and said: “Bil’am refuses to go with us.”

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹסִיף עוֹד בָּלָק לְמִשְׁלַח רַבְרְבִין סַגִיאִין וְיַקִירִין מֵאִלֵין
verses.ar_en: Balak persisted and sent dignitaries in greater number and of higher rank than these.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתוֹ לְוָת בִּלְעָם וַאֲמָרוּ לֵיהּ כִּדְנַן אֲמַר בָּלָק בַּר צִפּוֹר לָא כְעַן תִּתְמְנַע מִלְמֵיתֵי לְוָתִי
verses.ar_en: They came to Bil’am and said to him: “The following is a message from Balak the son Tzipor: ‘Please do not refuse to come to me.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְקָרָא אֲיַקְרִינָךְ לַחֲדָא וְכֹל דִי תֵימַר לִי אַעְבֵּד וְאִיתָא כְעַן לוֹט לִי יַת עַמָא הָדֵין
verses.ar_en: For I will honor you greatly and whatever you tell me, I will do, if you would just please come and curse this people for me.’”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתֵיב בִּלְעָם וַאֲמַר לְעַבְדֵי בָלָק אִם יִתֶּן לִי בָלָק מְלֵי בֵיתֵיהּ כְּסַף וּדְהַב לֵית לִי רְשׁוּ לְמֶעֱבַּר עַל גְזֵירַת מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָי לְמֶעְבַּד זְעֵרְתָּא אוֹ רַבְּתָא
verses.ar_en: Bil’am answered and said to Balak's servants: “Even if Balak would give me silver and gold enough to fill his house, I cannot [have no permission] transgress the word of Adonoy my God, by doing anything small or great.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן אוֹרִיכוּ כְעַן הָכָא אַף אַתּוּן בְּלֵילְיָא וְאִדַע מָה יוֹסֵף יְיָ לְמַלָלָא עִמִי
verses.ar_en: Now, you also, please remain here overnight, and I will get to know what more will Adonoy tell me.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתָּא מֵימַר מִן קֳדָם יְיָ לְבִלְעָם בְּלֵילְיָא וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ אִם לְמִקְרֵי לָךְ אֲתוֹ גֻבְרַיָא קוּם אִיזֵיל עִמְהוֹן וּבְרַם יַת פִּתְגָמָא דִי אֲמַלֵיל עִמָךְ יָתֵיהּ תַּעְבֵיד
verses.ar_en: God[’s word] appeared [before] to Bil’am that night and said to him: “If the men have come to call you, arise and go with them; however, whatever I will say to you, you will do.”

verses.ar_he: וְקָם בִּלְעָם בְּצַפְרָא וְזָרֵיז יַת אֲתָנֵיהּ וַאֲזַל עִם רַבְרְבֵי מוֹאָב
verses.ar_en: Bil’am arose in the morning, saddled [readied] his donkey, and went with the Moavite dignitaries.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקֵיף רָגְזָא דַיְיָ אֲרֵי אָזֵיל הוּא וְאִתְעַתַּד מַלְאָכָא דַיְיָ בְּאוֹרְחָא לְשָׂטָן לֵהּ וְהוּא רָכִיב עַל אַתָּנֵיהּ וּתְרֵין עוּלֵימוֹהִי עִמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: God showed anger because he went, and an angel of Adonoy placed himself in the way to thwart him, as he was riding on his donkey accompanied by his two attendants.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזַת אֲתָּנָא יַת מַלְאָכָא דַיְיָ מְעַתַּד בְּאָרְחָא וְחַרְבֵּיהּ שְׁלִיפָא בִּידֵיהּ וּסְטַת אֲתָּנָא מִן אוֹרְחָא וַאֲזָלַת בְּחַקְלָא וּמְחָא בִּלְעָם יַת אֲתָּנָא לְאַסְטָיוּתַהּ לְאָרְחָא
verses.ar_en: The donkey saw the angel of Adonoy standing in the way with his sword drawn in his hand; the donkey turned aside from the way and went into the field; Bil’am struck the donkey to get it back on the way.

verses.ar_he: וְקָם מַלְאָכָא דַיְיָ בִּשְׁבִיל כַּרְמַיָא אַתְרָא דְגָדֵירָא מִכָּא וְגָדֵירָא מִכָּא
verses.ar_en: But the angel of Adonoy stood in a narrow path of the vineyards [at a place] with a barrier at either side.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזַת אֲתָּנָא יַת מַלְאָכָא דַיְיָ וְאִדְחֵיקַת לְכָתְלָא וּדְחֵיקַת יַת רִגְלָא דְבִלְעָם לְכָתְלָא וְאוֹסִיף לְמִמְחַהּ
verses.ar_en: When the donkey saw the angel of Adonoy, she was pressed against the wall and pressed Bil’am's foot against the wall; and he struck her even more.

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹסֵף מַלְאָכָא דַיְיָ לְמֶעְבָּר וְקָם בַּאֲתַר עָק דִי לֵית אֹרַח לְמִסְטֵי לְיַמִינָא וְלִשְׂמָאלָא
verses.ar_en: Adonoy’s angel passed further ahead and stood in a narrow place, where there was no room to turn [either] to the right or to the left.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזַת אֲתָּנָא יַת מַלְאָכָא דַיְיָ וּרְבָעַת תְּחוֹת בִּלְעָם וּתְקֵיף רוּגְזָא דְבִלְעָם וּמְחָא יַת אֲתָּנָא בְּחֻטְרָא
verses.ar_en: When the donkey saw the angel of Adonoy, it crouched beneath Bil’am; Bil’am[’s anger was provoked] became angry and beat the donkey with the stick.

verses.ar_he: וּפְתַח יְיָ יַת פּוּמָא דַאֲתָּנָא וַאֲמָרַת לְבִּלְעָם מָה עֲבָדִית לָךְ אֲרֵי מְחִיתַנִי דְנַן תְּלַת זִמְנִין
verses.ar_en: Adonoy opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Bil’am: “What have I done to you, that you have hit me these three times?”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בִּלְעָם לַאֲתָּנָא אֲרֵי חַיִיכְתְּ בִּי אִלוּפוֹן אִית חַרְבָּא בִּידִי אֲרֵי כְעָן קְטַלְתִּיךְ
verses.ar_en: Bil’am said to the donkey: “Because you have ridiculed me; would that I had a sword in my hand, I would kill you now.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרַת אֲתָּנָא לְבִלְעָם הֲלָא אֲנָא אֲתָּנָךְ דְרָכַבְתְּ עֲלַי מִדְאִיתָךְ עַד יוֹמָא הָדֵין הֲמֵילַף אַלִפְנָא לְמֶעֱבַּד לָךְ כְּדֵין וַאֲמַר לָא
verses.ar_en: The donkey replied to Bil’am: “Am I not the very same donkey that you have been riding on all your life [from the time I became yours] until this very day? Was it ever my habit to do this to you?” And he said: “No.”

verses.ar_he: וּגְלָא יְיָ יַת עֵינֵי בִלְעָם וַחֲזָא יַת מַלְאָכָא דַיְיָ מְעַתַּד בְּאָרְחָא וְחַרְבֵּיהּ שְׁלִיפָא בִידֵיהּ וּכְרַע וּסְגִיד לְאַפּוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Adonoy then enabled Bil’am to see, and he observed the angel of Adonoy standing in the way with his sword drawn in his hand. He bowed his head and prostrated himself on his face.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ מַלְאָכָא דַיְיָ עַל מָה מָחִיתָא יַת אֲתָּנָךְ דְנַן תְּלַת זִמְנִין הָא אֲנָא נְפָקִית לְמִשְׂטַן אֲרֵי גְלֵי קֳדָמַי דְאַתְּ רָעֵי לְמֵיזַל בְּאוֹרְחָא לְקִבְּלִי
verses.ar_en: The angel of Adonoy said to him: “Why did you hit your donkey these three times? Behold, I came out to obstruct you, because your way is [it is clear to me that you desire to proceed on a path] contrary to me.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזַתְנִי אֲתָּנָא וּסְטַת מִן קֳדָמַי דְנַן תְּלַת זִמְנִין אִילוּפוֹן לָא סְטַּת מִן קֳדָמַי אֲרֵי כְעַן אַף יָתָךְ קְטָלִית וְיָתַהּ קַיֵימִית
verses.ar_en: And when the donkey saw me, it turned aside these three times; had she not turned aside before me as [she did] now I would surely have killed you and she, I would let live.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בִּלְעָם לְמַלְאָכָא דַיְיָ חָבִית אֲרֵי לָא יְדָעִית אֲרֵי אַתְּ מְעַתֵּד לָקֳדָמוּתִי בְּאָרְחָא וּכְעַן אִם בִּישׁ בְּעֵינָךְ אֵיתוּב לִי
verses.ar_en: Bil’am said to the angel of Adonoy: “I have sinned because I did not know that you were standing in the way before me; now therefore, if it is wicked in your eyes, I shall return.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר מַלְאָכָא דַיְיָ לְבִלְעָם אִיזֵיל עִם גוּבְרַיָא וּלְחוֹד יַת פִּתְגָמָא דִי אֲמַלֵיל עִמָךְ יָתֵיהּ תְּמַלֵיל וַאֲזַל בִּלְעָם עִם רַבְרְבֵי בָּלָק
verses.ar_en: The angel of Adonoy said to Bil’am: “Go with the men, but only the word that I will speak to you shall you speak” Bil’am then continued to go with Balak's dignitaries.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁמַע בָּלָק אֲרֵי אָתָא בִלְעָם וּנְפַק לָקֳדָמוּתֵה לְקַרְתָּא דְמוֹאָב דִי עַל תְּחוּם אַרְנוֹן דִי בִּסְטַר תְּחוּמָא
verses.ar_en: When Balak heard that Bil’am was coming, he went out to meet him, to the city of Moav, which is on the boundary of Arnon—at the very edge of the boundary.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בָּלָק לְבִלְעָם הֲלָא מִשְׁלַח שַׁלְחִית לְוָתָךְ לְמִקְרֵי לָךְ לְמָא לָא אֲתֵיתָא לְוָתִי הַבְקוּשְׁטָא הֲוֵיתָא אָמַר לֵית אֲנָא יָכִיל לְיַקְרוּתָךְ
verses.ar_en: Balak said to Bil’am: “Did I not send so many [dignitaries] to invite you? Why did you not come to me? Am I really [can you truthfully say that I am] incapable of honoring you?”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בִּלְעָם לְבָלָק הָא אֲתֵיתִי לְוָתָךְ כְּעַן הֲמֵיכַל יְכִלְנָא לְמַלָלָא מִדַעַם פִּתְגָמָא דִי יְשַׁוֵי יְיָ בְּפוּמִי יָתֵיהּ אֲמַלֵיל
verses.ar_en: Bil’am replied to Balak: “Now that I have come to you, have I any power to say anything? Only the word that God puts in my mouth will I speak.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲזַל בִּלְעָם עִם בָּלָק וַאֲתוֹ לְקִרְיַת מְחוֹזוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Bil’am went with Balak and they came to Kiryas Chutzos [the city of his territory].

verses.ar_he: וּנְכֵיס בָּלָק תּוֹרִין וְעָאן וּשְׁלַח לְבִלְעָם וּלְרַבְרְבַיָא דִי עִמֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: Balak slaughtered cattle and sheep and he sent some to Bil’am and to the dignitaries that were with him.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּצַפְרָא וּדְבַר בָּלָק יַת בִּלְעָם וְאַסְקֵיהּ לְרָמַת דַחַלְתֵּיהּ וַחֲזָא מִתַּמָן קְצַת מִן עַמָא
verses.ar_en: In the morning, Balak took Bil’am and he led him up to Bamos Ba’al [the high place of his idol]; from there he saw part of the people.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בִּלְעָם לְבָלָק בְּנֵה לִי הָכָא שַׁבְעָא מַדְבְּחִין וְאַתְקִין לִי הָכָא שַׁבְעָא תוֹרִין וְשַׁבְעָא דִכְרִין
verses.ar_en: Bil’am said to Balak: “Build seven altars for me here, and prepare for me seven bulls and seven rams.”

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד בָּלָק כְּמָא דִי מַלֵיל בִּלְעָם וְאַסֵיק בָּלָק וּבִלְעָם תּוֹר וּדְכַר עַל כָּל מַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: Balak did as Bil’am requested. Balak and Bil’am then sacrificed as burnt-offerings an ox and a ram on each altar.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בִּלְעָם לְבָלָק אִתְעַתֵּד עַל עֲלָתָךְ וְאֵיהַךְ מָאִים יְעָרַע מֵימַר מִן קֳדָם יְיָ לָקֳדָמוּתִי וּפִתְגָמָא דְיַחֲזִנַנִי וְאֵחַוֵי לָךְ וַאֲזַל יְחִידִי
verses.ar_en: Bil’am said to Balak: “Stand beside your burnt-offering and I will go away. Perhaps, [a word from before] Adonoy will appear to me, and whatever He will show me I will tell you.” And he went away alone.

verses.ar_he: וְעָרַע מֵימַר מִן קֳדָם יְיָ לְוַת בִּלְעָם וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ יַת שַׁבְעָא מַדְבְּחִין סְדָרִית וְאַסֵקִית תּוֹר וּדְכַר עַל כָּל מַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: [A word from before] God chanced to appear to Bil’am, and he said to Him: “I have set up the seven altars and I offered [as burnt-offerings] an ox and a ram on the altar.”

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִי יְיָ פִּתְגָמָא בְּפוּמָא דְבִלְעָם וַאֲמַר תּוּב לְוַת בָּלָק וּכְדֵין תְּמַלֵיל
verses.ar_en: Adonoy put a message in Bil’am's mouth and He said: “Return to Balak and tell him as follows.”

verses.ar_he: וְתַב לְוָתֵיהּ וְהָא מְעַתֵּד עַל עֲלָתֵיהּ הוּא וְכָל רַבְרְבֵי מוֹאָב
verses.ar_en: When he returned, Balak was still standing next to his burnt-offering together with all the dignitaries of Moav.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטַל מַתְלֵיהּ וַאֲמַר מִן אֲרָם דַבְּרַנִי בָלָק מַלְכָּא דְמוֹאָב מִטוּרֵי מַדִנְחָא אִיתָא לוֹטּ לִי יַעֲקֹב וְאִיתָא תָּרֵיךְ לִי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: Bil’am set forth his parable, and said: “From Aram has Balak, King of Moav, brought me, out of the mountains of the east [saying]: 'Come, curse Yaakov for me; go, invoke wrath against Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: מָה אֲלוֹטֵיהּ דְלָא לַטְיֵהּ אֵל וּמָה אֲתָרְכֵיהּ דְלָא תָרְכֵיהּ יְיָ
verses.ar_en: How can I curse, when God has not cursed? What Divine wrath can I evoke if Adonoy has not been angry?

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי מֵרֵישׁ טוּרַיָא חֲזִיתֵיהּ וּמֵרָמָתָא סְכִיתֵיהּ הָא עַמָא בִּלְחוֹדֵיהוֹן עֲתִידִין דְיַחְסְנוּן עַלְמָא וּבְעַמְמַיָא לָא יִתְדְנוּן גְמִירָא
verses.ar_en: For I view it, from the mountain peaks, I gaze upon it from the hills; behold! A people which shall dwell alone [and are destined to inhabit the world] and will not be reckoned among the nations [not be judged for annihilation].

verses.ar_he: מָן יֵיכוֹל לְמִמְנֵי דַעַדְקַיָא דְבֵית יַעֲקֹב דְאָמִיר עֲלֵיהוֹן יִסְגוּן כְּעַפְרָא דְאַרְעָא אוֹ חֲדָא מֵאַרְבַּע מַשִׁרְיָתָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל תְּמוּת נַפְשִׁי מוֹתָא דְקַשִׁיטוֹהִי וּתְהֵי סוֹפִי כְּוַתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Who can count the dust of [the house of] Yaakov [of whom it is said: they will multiply as the dust of the earth] or count the seed of Yisroel [or one of the four camps of Yisrael]? May my soul die the death of the righteous, and let my end be like his.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בָּלָק לְבִלְעָם מֶה עֲבַדְתָּא לִי לְמֵילַט סַנְאַי דְבַרְתִּיךְ וְהָא בְּרָכָא מְבָרְכַת לְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Balak said to Bil’am: “What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies but you have in fact blessed them!”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתֵיב וַאֲמַר הֲלָא יָת דִי יְשַׁוֵי יְיָ בְּפוּמִי יָתֵיהּ אֶטַר לְמַלָלָא
verses.ar_en: Bil’am replied and said: “Only what Adonoy tells me must I be careful to say.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ בָּלָק אִיתָא כְעַן עִמִי לַאֲתַר אוֹחֲרָן דְתֶחֱזִנֵיהּ מִתַּמָן לְחוֹד קְצָתֵיהּ תֶּחֱזֵי וְכוּלֵיהּ לָא תֶחֱזֵי וּתְלוּטֵיהּ לִי מִתַּמָן
verses.ar_en: Balak then said to him, “Come with me to another place from where you will see them. But you will see only a part of them, without seeing them all, and curse them for me from there.”

verses.ar_he: וְדַבְּרֵיהּ לַחֲקַל סְכוּתָא לְרֵישׁ רָמָתָא וּבְנָא שַׁבְעָא מַדְבְּחִין וְאַסֵיק תּוֹר וּדְכַר עַל כָּל מַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: He took him [Bil’am] to the field of Tzofim, to the peak of the mountain; he built seven altars and sacrificed as a burnt-offering a bull and a ram on each altar.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְבָלָק אִתְעַתֵּד הָכָא עַל עֲלָתָךְ וַאֲנָא אִתְמְטֵי עַד כָּא
verses.ar_en: He then said to Balak: “Stand here next to your burnt-offering, and I will be called here by chance [will continue there].”

verses.ar_he: וְעָרַע מֵימַר מִן קֳדָם יְיָ לְבִלְעָם וְשַׁוִי פִתְגָמָא בְּפוּמֵיהּ וַאֲמַר תּוּב לְוָת בָּלָק וּכְדֵין תְּמַלֵיל
verses.ar_en: [A word from before] Adonoy chanced to appear to Bil’am and placed the word in his mouth; He said: “Return to Balak and say as follows.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתָא לְוָתֵיהּ וְהוּא מְעַתַּד עַל עֲלָתֵיהּ וְרַבְרְבֵי מוֹאָב עִמֵיהּ וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ בָּלָק מָה מַלִיל יְיָ
verses.ar_en: When he returned, he (Balak) was still standing next to his burnt-offering accompanied by the Moavite dignitaries; Balak asked: “What did Adonoy say?”

verses.ar_he: וּנְטַל מַתְלֵיהּ וַאֲמַר קוּם בָּלָק וּשְׁמַע אָצִית לְמֵימְרִי בַּר צִפֹּר
verses.ar_en: Bil’am set forth his parable, and said: “Arise, Balak, and hear, listen closely to me [my word], son of Tzipor.

verses.ar_he: לָא כְמִלֵי בְּנֵי אֱנָשָׁא מֵימַר אֱלָהָא בְּנֵי אֱנָשָׁא אָמְרִין וּמְכַדְבִין וְאַף לָא כְעוֹבָדֵי בְּנֵי בִּשְׂרָא דְאִינוּן גָזְרִין לְמֶעְבַּד וְתַיְבִין וּמִתְמַלְכִין דְהוּא אָמַר וְעָבֵיד וְכָל מֵימְרֵהּ מִתְקַיָם
verses.ar_en: God is not like man that He should act falsely, nor is He mortal that He should change His mind. [God’s word is not as that of man who speaks with deceit. Nor is it as that of mankind who decree and then change their mind] Would He say and not do it? Or speak and not fulfill it [He says and does, and His word endures]?

verses.ar_he: הָא בִּרְכָן קַבֵּילִית וַאֲבָרֵכִינֵיהּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל וְלָא אָתֵב בִּרְכְּתִי מִינֵיה
verses.ar_en: Behold, I was commanded to bless, and [when] He has blessed, I cannot reverse it [turn my blessing from him].

verses.ar_he: אִסְתַּכָּלִית לֵית פָּלְחֵי גִלוּלִין בִּדְבֵית יַעֲקֹב וְאַף לָא עָבְדֵי לֵיאוּת שְׁקַר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָהוֹן בְּסַעְדְהוֹן וּשְׁכִינַת מַלְכְּהוֹן בֵּינֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: [Behold,] One does not see evildoers [there are no idol worshippers] in [the house of] Yaakov; and He has seen no transgression [nor is there the work of liars] in Yisroel; [the word of] Adonoy, his God, is with [aids them] him, and he has the King's friendship [and the Shechinah of their King is among them].

verses.ar_he: אֱלָהָא דְאַפֵּקִנוּן מִמִצְרָיִם תּוּקְפָא וְרוּמָא דִילֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: God Who has brought them out of Egypt, has shown His great strength to them [with His might and loftiness].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי לָא נַחֲשַׁיָא צָבָן דְיִיטַב לִדְבֵית יַעֲקֹב וְאַף לָא קְסָמַיָא רְעַן בִּרְבוּת בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּעִדַן יִתְאַמַר לְיַעֲקֹב וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל מָה עֲבַד אֱלָהָא
verses.ar_en: For, there is no sorcery in [sorcerers wish no good to come to the house of] Yaakov, nor occult powers against [nor greatness for the house of] Yisroel; in due time it will be said to Yaakov and Yisroel, 'What has God done?'

verses.ar_he: הָא עַמָא כְּלֵיתָא שָׁרֵי וּכְאַרְיָא יִתְנַטֵל לָא יִשְׁרֵי בְאַרְעֵיהּ עַד דְיִקְטוֹל קְטוֹל וְנִכְסֵי עֲמְמַיָא יֵירָת
verses.ar_en: Behold, a people that rises [dwells] like a young lion, and lifts itself up like a lion; he does not lie down [dwell in his land] until it devours its prey [slaughters the kill] and drinks the blood of its kill [inherits the wealth of nations].”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בָּלָק לְבִלְעָם אַף מֵילַט לָא תְלוּטִּינוּן אַף בְּרָכָא לָא תְבָרֵכִינוּן
verses.ar_en: Balak said to Bil’am: “Also do not curse them, also do not bless them.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתֵיב בִּלְעָם וַאֲמַר לְבָלָק הֲלָא מַלֵילִית עִמָךְ לְמֵימַר כֹּל דִי יְמַלֵל יְיָ יָתֵיהּ אַעֲבֵיד
verses.ar_en: Bil’am answered Balak and said: “Did I not tell you that all that Adonoy tells me will I do.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בָּלָק לְבִלְעָם אִיתָא כְּעַן אֲדַבְּרִינָךְ לַאֲתַר אָחֳרָן מָאִים יְהֵי רַעֲוָא מִן קֳדָם יְיָ וּתְלוּטֵיהּ לִי מִתַּמָן
verses.ar_en: Balak then said to Bil’am: “Come, I will take you somewhere else, perhaps God will consider it proper [it will be the will before Hashem] and you will curse them for me, from there.”

verses.ar_he: וּדְבַר בָּלָק יַת בִּלְעָם רֵישׁ רָמָתָא דְמִסְתַּכְּיָא עַל אַפֵּי בֵּית יְשִׁימוֹן
verses.ar_en: Balak took Bil’am to the peak of Pe’or which overlooks the Yeshimon.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בִּלְעָם לְבָלָק בְּנֵה לִי הָכָא שַׁבְעָא מַדְבְּחִין וְאַתְקִין לִי הָכָא שַׁבְעָא תוֹרִין וְשַׁבְעָא דִכְרִין
verses.ar_en: Bil’am said to Balak: “Build seven altars for me here and prepare for me seven bulls and seven rams.”

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד בָּלָק כְּמָא דִי אֲמַר בִּלְעָם וְאַסֵיק תּוֹר וּדְכַר עַל כָּל מַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: Balak did as Bil’am said, and he sacrificed as a burnt-offering a bull and a ram on each altar.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא בִלְעָם אֲרֵי תַקִין קֳדָם יְיָ לְבָרָכָא יַת יִשְׂרָאֵל וְלָא הַלַךְ כִּזְמַן בִּזְמַן אֱלָהֵין לָקֳדָמוּת נְחָשַׁיָא וְשַׁוִי לָקָבֵיל עֶגְלָא דַעֲבָדוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמַדְבְּרָא אַפּוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: When Bil’am saw that it was favorable [fitting before] to Adonoy to bless Yisroel, he did not approach, as at each time, towards sorcery; but he set his face toward the wilderness.

verses.ar_he: וּזְקֵף בִּלְעָם יָת עֵינוֹהִי וַחֲזָא יָת יִשְׂרָאֵל שָׁרָן לְשִׁבְטוֹהִי וּשְׁרַת עֲלוֹהִי רוּחַ נְבוּאָה מִן קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Bil’am raised his eyes and saw Israel encamped according to its tribes, and the spirit of God rested upon him [prophesy from before Hashem].

verses.ar_he: וּנְטַל מַתְלֵיהּ וַאֲמַר אֵימַר בִּלְעָם בְּרֵיהּ בְעוֹר וְאֵימַר גַבְרָא דְשַׁפִּיר חָזֵי
verses.ar_en: He set forth his parable, and said: “This is the declaration of Bil’am, the son of Be’or; this is the declaration of the man of the open-socketed eye [who sees well].

verses.ar_he: אֵימַר דִשְׁמַע מֵימַר מִן קֳדָם אֵל וְחֵזוּ מִן קֳדָם שַׁדַי חָזֵי שְׁכִיב וּמִתְגְלֵי לֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: This is the declaration of one who hears [from before] God's utterance, who sees the vision of [from before] the Almighty; fallen, with opened eyes [it is apparent to him].

verses.ar_he: מָה טָבָא מַשְׁכְּנָךְ יַעֲקֹב בֵּית מֵישְׁרָךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: How goodly are your tents [land], Yaakov, your dwelling places, Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: כְּנַחֲלִין דִמְדַבְּרִין כְּגִינַת שַׁקְיָא דְעַל פְּרָת כְּבוּסְמַיָא דִנְצִיב יְיָ כְּאַרְזִין דִנְצִבִין עַל מַיָא
verses.ar_en: They stretch forth like streams, like gardens by the river [flowing like irrigated gardens near Peras], like the aloe trees that Adonoy has planted; like cedar trees [standing] by the water.

verses.ar_he: יִסְגֵי מַלְכָּא דְיִתְרַבָּא מִבְּנוֹהִי וְיִשְׁלוֹט בְּעַמְמִין סַגִיאִין וְיִתְקוֹף מֵאֲגַג מַלְכֵּיהּ וְתִתְנַטֵל מַלְכוּתֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: Water flows out from his buckets, and his seed will have an abundant flow [the anointed king shall grow and rule over many nations]; his king will be greater than Agag and his monarchy shall be uplifted.

verses.ar_he: אֱלָהָא דְאַפֵּקִינוּן מִמִצְרַיִם תּוּקְפָא וְרוּמָא דִילֵיהּ יֵיכְלוּן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל נִכְסֵי עַמְמַיָא סַנְאֵיהוֹן וּבְבִזַת מַלְכֵּיהוֹן יִתְפַּנְקוּן וְאַרְעֲתְהוֹן יַחְסְנוּן
verses.ar_en: God Who has brought him out of Egypt, has shown His great strength to him [might and loftiness is His]; He will consume His enemy nations, crushing their bones and dip His arrows [in their blood] [Bnei Yisroel will eat from the wealth of the nations—their enemies, and will enjoy the spoils of their kings, and will inhabit their land].

verses.ar_he: יְנוּחַ יִשְׁרֵי בִתְקוֹף כְּאַרְיָא וּכְלֵתָא לֵית מַלְכוּ דְתִזַעֲזְעִינֵיהּ בְּרִיכָךְ יְהוֹן בְּרִיכִין וְלִיטָךְ יְהוֹן לִיטִין
verses.ar_en: He crouches and lies [rests and dwells with might] like a lion, and, being a lion, who would dare rouse him? [No kingdom can cause him fear.] those who bless you are blessed, and those who curse you are cursed.”

verses.ar_he: וּתְקֵיף רוּגְזָא דְבָלָק בְּבִלְעָם וּשְׁקָפִינוּן לִידוֹהִי וַאֲמַר בָּלָק לְבִלְעָם לְמֵילַט סַנְאַי קְרִיתָךְ וְהָא בָּרָכָא מְבָרְכַת לְהוֹן דְנַן תְּלַת זִמְנִין
verses.ar_en: Balak became enraged at Bil’am and clapped his hands together; Balak then said to Bil’am: “I called you to curse my enemies, but you have blessed them these three times.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן אִזֵיל לָךְ לְאַתְרָךְ אֲמָרִית יְקָרָא אֲיַקְרִינָךְ וְהָא מְנָעָךְ יְיָ מִן יְקָר
verses.ar_en: Now, hurry [go] back home! I said I would exceedingly honor you, but Adonoy has held you back from honor.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בִּלְעָם לְבָלָּק הֲלָא אַף לְאִזְגַדָךְ דִי שַׁלְחַת לְוָתִי מַלֵילִית לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Bil’am said to Balak: “Even to your emissaries whom you sent to me I said:

verses.ar_he: אִם יִתֶּן לִי בָלָק מְלֵי בֵיתֵיהּ כְּסַף וּדְהַב לֵית לִי רְשׁוּ לְמֶעֱבַּר עַל גְזֵירַת מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ לְמֶעֱבַּד טַבְתָּא אוֹ בִּישְׁתָּא מֵרְעוּתִי דִי יְמַלֵל יְיָ יָתֵיהּ אֲמַלֵיל
verses.ar_en: ‘Even if Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot transgress the word of Adonoy to do good or evil [from] on my own [will];’ only what Adonoy declares will I speak.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן הָא אֲנָא אָזֵיל לְעַמִי אִיתָא אֲמַלְכִינָךְ מָה דְתַּעְבֵיד וַאֲחַוֵי לָךְ מָא דְיַעֲבֵד עַמָא הָדֵין לְעַמָךְ בְּסוֹף יוֹמַיָא
verses.ar_en: And now that I am returning to my people, come, I will advise you [what you should do and I will show you] what this people will do to your people in the end of days.”

verses.ar_he: וּנְטַל מַתְלֵיהּ וַאֲמַר אֵימַר בִּלְעָם בְּרֵיהּ בְעוֹר וְאֵימַר גַבְרָא דְשַׁפִּיר חָזֵי
verses.ar_en: He set forth his parable, and said: “This is the declaration of Bil’am the son of Beor, the declaration of the man, of the open-sockered eye [sees well].

verses.ar_he: אֵימַר דִשְׁמַע מֵימַר מִן קֳדָם אֵל וִידַע מַדַע מִן קֳדָם עִילָאָה חֵיזוּ מִן קֳדָם שַׁדַי חָזֵי שְׁכִיב וּמִתְגְלֵי לֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: This is the declaration of one who hears God's utterances and knows the thoughts of the Most Exalted; who sees the vision of the Almighty; fallen, with opened eyes [and is apparent to him].

verses.ar_he: חֲזִיתֵיהּ וְלָא כְעַן סְכִיתֵיהּ וְלָא אִיתוֹהִי קָרִיב כַּד יְקוּם מַלְכָּא מִיַעֲקֹב וְיִתְרַבָּא מְשִׁיחָא מִיִשְׂרָאֵל וְיִקְטּוֹל רַבְרְבֵי מוֹאָב וְיִשְׁלוֹט בְּכָל בְּנֵי אֱנָשָׁא
verses.ar_en: I see it but not now, I perceive it but not in the near future; a star [king] has gone forth from Yaakov, and a staff has arisen [the Moshiach will be magnified by] from Yisroel, which will smash the corners [kill the leaders] of Moav, and impale all of the sons of Sheis [will rule over mankind].

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אֱדוֹם יְרוּתָּא וִיהֵי יְרוּתָּא שֵׂעִיר לְבַעֲלֵי דְבָבוֹהִי וְיִשְׂרָאֵל יַצְלַח בְּנִכְסִין
verses.ar_en: Edom will be possession and Seir shall become the possession of his enemies; but Yisroel will triumph [be successful in enterprise].

verses.ar_he: וְיֵיחוּת חָד מִדְבֵית יַעֲקֹב וְיוֹבִיד מְשֵׁיזִיב מִקִרְיַת עַמְמַיָא
verses.ar_en: A ruler shall come from [the house of] Yaakov, who will annihilate the survivors of the city.”

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא יַת עֲמַלְקָאָה וּנְטַל מַתְלֵיהּ וַאַמַר רֵישׁ קְרָבַיָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל הֲוָה עֲמַלְקָאָה וְסוֹפֵיהּ לְעָלְמָא יֵיבָד
verses.ar_en: When Bil’am saw Amalek, he declared his parable, and said: “Amalek was the first among nations [to fight with Yisroel], and his end will be total destruction.”

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא יַת שַׁלְמָאָה וּנְטַל מַתְלֵיהּ וַאֲמַר תַּקִיף בֵּית מוֹתְבָךְ וְשַׁוֵי בִכְרַךְ תַּקִּיף מְדוֹרָךְ
verses.ar_en: [When] he saw the Keinite [Shalmites], he set forth his parable, and said: “How powerful is your dwelling place, and set in a cliff your nest [your dwelling in a forified city].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי אִם יְהֵי לְשֵׁיצָאָה שַׁלְמָאָה עַד מָה אֲתוּרָאָה יִשְׁבִּינָךְ
verses.ar_en: For, if Kayin is to be uprooted [the Shalmites are to be destroyed], until where will Ashur take you captive?”

verses.ar_he: וּנְטַל מַתְלֵיהּ וַאֲמַר וַי לְחַיָיבַיָא דְיֵחוֹן כַּד יַעֲבֵּד אֱלָהָא יָת אִלֵין
verses.ar_en: He set forth his parable, and said: “Alas! Who can survive from God's devastation? [Woe to those evil people who are living when Hashem does this.]

verses.ar_he: וְסִיעַן יִצְטַרְחַן מֵרוֹמָאֵי וִיעֲנוּן לְאָתוּר וְיִשְׁתַּעְבְּדוּן לְעֵבַר פְּרָת וְאַף אִינוּן לְעָלְמָא יֵיבְדוּן
verses.ar_en: Warships will come from Kittim [groups will beg help from Rome] and destroy Ashur, and cause suffering to those on the other side [will enslave those beyond Peras], but they, too, shall be lost for eternity.”

verses.ar_he: וְקָם בִּלְעָם וַאֲזַל וְתָב לְאַתְרֵיהּ וְאַף בָּלָק אֲזַל לְאוֹרְחֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: Bil’am arose, went, and returned home; and Balak too, went on his way.

verses.ar_he: וִיתֵיב יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּשִׁיטִין וּשְׁרֵי עַמָא לְמִטְּעֵי בָּתַר בְּנַת מוֹאָב
verses.ar_en: Yisroel settled in Shittim and the people [of Yisroel] began acting promiscuously with the daughters of Moav.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָאָן לְעַמָא לְדִבְחֵי טַעֲוַתְהוֹן וַאֲכַל עַמָא וּסְגִידוּ לְטַעֲוַתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: They [girls of Moav] invited the people [of Yisroel] to their idolatrous sacrifices [abominations]; and the people ate and prostrated themselves before their gods [abominations].

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְחַבַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל לְבַעֲלָא פְעוֹר וּתְקֵף רוּגְזָא דַיְיָ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: Yisroel became united with Ba’al Pe’or; and the rage of Adony flared against Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה דְבַר יַת כָּל רֵישֵׁי עַמָא וְדוּן וּקְטוֹל דְחַיָב קְטוֹל קֳדָם יְיָ לָקֳבֵל שִׁמְשָׁא וִיתוּב תְּקוֹף רוּגְזָא דַיְיָ מִיִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe: “Take all the leaders of the people and hang them, [judge and execute those guilty by death] before Adonoy, facing the sun; thereby removing the rage of Adony against Yisroel.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְדַיָנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל קְטִילוּ גְבַר גַבְרוֹהִי דְאִתְחַבָּרוּ לְבַעֲלָא פְעוֹר
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to the judges of Yisroel: “Each of you must execute his men who were united with Ba’al Pe’or.”

verses.ar_he: וְהָא גַבְרָא מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲתָא וְקָרֵב לְוָת אֲחוֹהִי יָת מִדְיָנֵיתָא לְעֵינֵי משֶׁה וּלְעֵינֵי כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאִינוּן בָּכָן בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: And behold, a man came from among Bnei Yisroel, and brought the Midianite woman to his brethren, before the eyes of Moshe and before the eyes of the entire congregation of Yisroel, who were weeping at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא פִּינְחָס בַּר אֶלְעָזָר בַּר אַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנָא וְקָם מִגוֹ כְנִשְׁתָּא וּנְסֵיב רוֹמְחָא בִידֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: When he saw this—Pinchas the son of Elazar [and grand]son of Aharon the Kohein—he rose up from the midst of the community and took a spear in his hand.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל בָּתַר גַבְרָא בַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל לְקוּבָּתָא וּבְזַע יַת תַּרְוֵיהוֹן יַת גַבְרָא בַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיַת אִתְּתָא לִמְעָהָא וְאִתְכְּלִי מוֹתָנָא מֵעַל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: He followed the Israelite man into the inner chamber of the tent and pierced both of them through—the Israelite man and the woman through her belly—and the plague stopped from [afflicting] the Bnei Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲווֹ דְמִיתוּ בְּמוֹתָנָא עַשְׂרִין וְאַרְבְּעָה אַלְפִין
verses.ar_en: Those that died in the plague, [numbered] twenty-four thousand.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe saying.

verses.ar_he: פִּינְחָס בַּר אֶלְעָזָר בַּר אַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנָא אֲתֵיב יַת חֵמְתִי מֵעַל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּדְקַנֵי יַת קִנְאָתִי בֵּינֵיהוֹן וְלָא שֵׁיצֵיתִי יַת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּקִנְאָתִי
verses.ar_en: “Pinchas, the son of Elozor, [and grand] son of Aharon the kohein, has turned My anger away from Bnei Yisroel by his vengeance for Me among them, so that I did not destroy Bnei Yisroel in My vengeance.

verses.ar_he: בְּכֵן אֵימַר הָא אֲנָא גְזַר לֵיהּ יַת קְיָמִי שְׁלָם
verses.ar_en: Therefore tell [him], that I give [decree for] him My covenant [of] peace.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי לֵיהּ וְלִבְנוֹהִי בַּתְרוֹהִי קְיַם כְּהֻנַת עֲלָם חֲלַף דִי קַנֵי קֳדָם אֱלָהֵהּ וְכַפֵּר עַל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: It shall be for him and his descendants after him a covenant of eternal kehunah because he was zealous for [before] his God and made atonement for Bnei Yisroel.”

verses.ar_he: וְשׁוּם גַבְרָא בַּר יִשְרָאֵל קְטִילָא דִי אִתְקְטֵל עִם מִדְיָנֵיתָא זִמְרִי בַּר סָלוּא רַב בֵּית אַבָּא לְבֵית שִׁמְעוֹן
verses.ar_en: The name of the slain Israelite man, who was killed along with the Midianite woman, was Zimri, son of Salu, leader of a paternal house of Shimon.

verses.ar_he: וְשׁוּם אִתְּתָא דְאִתְקְטִילַת מִדְיָנֵיתָא כָּזְבִּי בַּת צוּר רֵישׁ אוּמֵי בֵּית אַבָּא בְּמִדְיָן הוּא
